Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
While Major in this movies has similar question in agony where her "Ghost" rests, --weather in her body or else-- she seems really fragile and very much victimized which kinda takes away tough version of her that I've seen in "Innocence,"
They did really good job at recreating a setting where weird combination of over-industrialization and nostalgia are simultaneously present (though I feel like U.S Sci-Fi film in general has great in terms of creating dystopian atmosphere). I would have loved this movie even more I they put a little more emphasis on posing mind blowing, open-ending philosophical view.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: The visuals are fabulous & the graphics are top notch, but the actors don't have any chemistry & the acting is very underwhelming, it seems to me like the actors were not pushed into giving better performances, some of choreographed fight scenes are very poor & in certain scenes the editing leaves you very confused, almost like the cut scenes were suppose to be shown in a completely different order, if I wasn't a fan of the anime I would not have known what was happening in the film, I didn't like the fact that they took out all the philosophical & existential concepts, I guess it had to be dumbed down for an American audience, still the last 30 minutes of the film were really great, the spider tank was amazing but the anime outshines the live action in everyway except for the visuals they were great, I give it 3 out of 5 stars for the effort.

Comment: i heard its a manga adaption, anyway i was get borrow some dvds from our library today and this one movie its very great really. the action is fast and even if its in the future the weapons are quite realistic also the way she infiltrate places with a single pistol. makes anyway more sense inside buildings. scarlett johansson is in my opinion a very good decision for such kinda movies i mean science fiction. ( okay its an anime adaptation technically , anyway) the story is also ok. best is the world and the whole city is a  possible scenery. and the details and the possibility to modify your body if you had the money. this could be real soon and then i think a world where you can upgrade , modify or change your look money becomes more important. to be honest i would save some to get good quality body parts. for me the movie is one of the best cyberpunk or anime adapts. by the way the coulours and the look is its very stylish the lights hologramms and this part where she's diving. i look a lot of movies actually there is a lot of junk, a lot of movies how  entertaim u with actuon but  some movies are still epic and this is one of em , and since 1yaer i read more mangas and like cyberpunk so i shuld watch this earlier. anyway could identify myself with the main protagonist  great work.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
To hell with what the whiny idiots say, this is actually the BEST adaption of an anime/manga we’ve had. Period.

It’s true to the source material, beautifully filmed and cast (and even the creator have Johansson his blessing to play Major), one of the best scores I’ve ever heard, and a wonderful story with many homages to the other films.

The fact that this has a lower rating from audiences than the live action Full Metal Alchemist movie (one of the most PAINFUL movies and adaptions I’ve ever sat through) tells me how many idiots there are.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
There was a great injustice done to this movie motivated by racism for the sake of ratings. No, not ScarJo’s casting; Tricky’s casting.

Musician named Tricky was set to play a Tibetan monk to guide the Major through her spiritual journey in 30 minutes of philosophical jargon this movie sorely needed. Chinese financiers put their collective foot down and insisted this reference to Tibetan culture be gutted from the movie. Wasn’t even reimplemented in the Blu-Ray. Also, the monk’s name was Pazu. Ever notice Paz got replaced by a new girl in this movie?

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: SAW THIS IN THE THEATER....AND NOW RE-WATCHING IT ON DVD....IT'S ON PAUSE......THE 2ND VIEWING IS VERY IMPORTANT......IT WILL LET U KNOW IF U WERE RIGHT OR WRONG IN YOUR ASSESMENT OF THE FILM THE 1ST TIME AROUND....PLUS U CAN GET SOME EXTRA DETAILS THAT U WILL NATURALLY MISS THE 1ST TIME AROUND...MY FIRST IMPRESSION OF THIS FILM WAS..."SLIGHTLY DARK,INTRIGUING (in all of it's exsistential and philosophical implications),VISUALLY EPIC...(in it's ability to show a fantastic amalgamation and man and technology as one)...THRILLING,AND JUST BASICALLY A GREAT FILM EXPERIENCE....I BELIEVE I WAS ON THE EDGE OF MY SEAT THE WHOLE TIME....ALSO.....THIS FILM DOES SOMETHING WITH COLOR AND SOUND THAT IS AS BRILLIANT AND ADVANCED AS ANYTHING I'VE EVER SEEN FROM KUBRICK OR SPIELBERG OR WHOEVER...THE COLORS IN THIS FILM ARE MEANT TO MAKE U FEEL A CERTAIN WAY....THEY ARE USED TO GREAT EFFECT TO MAKE U BELIEVE IN THIS WORLD....SAME THING WITH THE SOUND...THE MUSIC IS A GODSEND,PERIOD....IT'S THE BEST....U COULD'NT ASK FOR MORE FITTING MUSIC FOR THIS KIND OF STORY...IT'S THE STRANGER THINGS SOUNDTRACK 100 YEARS IN THE FUTURE....THAT'S A COMPLIMENT....IT IS.....AND THE VISUALS,IT'S LIKE....THERE'S SO MUCH DETAIL IN THE VISUALS I'M JUST AMAZED...IT'S JUST LIKE IMAGINATION OVERLOAD....VERY,VERY AMBITIOUS...EVERY FRAME IS JUST ARTISTICALLY GORGEOUS...PACKED WITH COOL COLORS,MUSIC,SOUND FX AND IMAGERY....AND I DO BELIEVE AT TIMES THIS FILM CAN BECOME HEART-BREAKINGLY DEEP...WITH IT'S INTERESTING PHILOSOPHICAL IMPLICATIONS AND CIRCUMSTANCES........OK.....B4 I FINISH THIS MOVIE,LET ME SAY,I THINK THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST SCI-FI MOVIES EVER MADE....HANDS DOWN....LISTEN TO NO NEGATIVITY ABOUT THIS FILM.....IT'S REALLY A WONDER TO BEHOLD

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Just want to vent my emotions after watching it again so... Scarlett and all the other actors are the only good thing in this movie. The problem is just dumb script and dialogues which over-explain every banal thing but omit all the real stuff (probably it was too deep for the scriptwriters to read sum basic post-modern philosophy so they had to fill that hole with glorifying simple idea of individuality which was safer and commercially more feasible bet to keep the casual movie-goer and his uniqueness satisfied) Too much exposition of the world, killing all the mystery and subtlety and at the same time too much uselessly floating CGI's again added but for wrong reasons, ironically just to hide the emptiness of the world. Cartoon-like evil characters with obvious names, obtusive playing on feelings like every damn 5 minutes. I would cut first 5 minutes out of the movie completely. The intro unlike originals doesn't have any impact. Also the score is kinda bleak... aaand the biggest fail for me: Motoko Kusanagi was always just an alias not her real name so the justification for whitewashing was totaly unnecessarry. There!...... I feel better now.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: So why does her Shell look like a bodysuit? I thought Shells were supposed to look just like an organic body. I wouldn't mind seeing this as a simple design change, but it's so painfully obvious it was done to get a PG13 rating to rake in the most cash, because Americans are still afraid of nudity. The opening wasn't supposed to be an action sequence. It sets up the basics of the world, Section 6's militant structure (or is that section 9? Damn Manga's dub is confusing), the Major's job, and the abilities of a Shell. The story seems to have been altered drastically, with the Major being the first Ghost to have a Shell, but so many other things are kept the same. This just looks like as big as a disaster as Dragon Ball Evolution. I really hope anime producers stop licensing their properties to American film companies.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
mixed feelings about this, some of the fanservice is really great looking but also seems pretty shallow.

The dialogue is really superficial at times, and while it touches on some of the complex themes from the anime, it feels like it just regurgitates them, loosing some of the depth in translatation, and just glosses over them.


I think the second half of the movie was alot better when it got into it's stride a bit more, i really liked the scenes with the major and her mother i thought they were done well, and that adds alot, as i think they did get over the major's feelings of lonilness quite well which gave these scenes more impact.

It's worth a watch, and you probably do get more out of it if you have some knowledge of the series going in, but it's nothing particularly groundbreaking as with most live action adaptations, so just set your expectations going in.

Comment:
I loved Ghost in the shell 1 and 2,  and the series is beyond mind blowing for an anime.  But this is not ghost in the shell and not one single person out there will ever convince me of that!

I don't care about the whitewashing stuff,  the anime characters many of whom look like white people. 

But it felt like they took the idea of wow shes nude, lets add more nudity areas.  when she goes invisible, she normally stays there for that event,  but the trailer above proves that wrong.

and the most recent trailer talks of her getting revenge,  She never had a real requirement of "Revenege" and nor was there ever a need for "Bad Guys"  these were Military Styled missions! they didn't need a Bad Guy like every one of these GoodGuy/BadGuy films just seem to have to film about.

Ghost in the shell was a Story, in the series there were many missions, in the first film it was about a Rogue persons spirit inside a bot that showed  unlimited limitations past the ghost body bodies original thought to be design.  thus -Ghost in the Shell!


I'm sorry but this is my rant on this film and the other screwed up "anime to life" films that America screws over >.>

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Has anyone noticed the parallels between Ghost In The Shell (2017), Under The Skin, and Her?  

These three films star Scarlett Johansson and are about her either forgetting, discovering, and/or transcending her identity. In these three films, the line between human and nonhuman are blurred and almost indistinguishable.  Although not intended, I feel that these films are linked.

Scarlet Johansson is one of the finest actors of her generation & a babe to boot but when are Hollywood going to fund a movie that has foreign elements with all of the actors from those actual countries...

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Got bored during break:
**First 7 minutes of the ghost in the shell movie. **
-- " Deus Ex 3 synth music 'Bwaahs' " Stop doing this...... 100% of post-2009 scifi movies don't need 100% identical synth music.
- Generic amnesia plot for the first dialogue in the entire movie. Was this written by the emo in the back of highschool algebra class or something?

**edit:**  Yup.  The ugly forgettable deus ex "bwaa" music goes on for 21 minutes . . . . oh and deleted some bullet points because they are selfish xD

--31 minutes in: " Hack this, hack that, he's being hacked, that's being hacked, hacked hacked hacked " Don't insult your audience by dumbing down everything into leymans-terms  xD

I will say though. I am loving the 'bro'mance between the major and batou though. lol  Guess that's one of the perks of being the director//writer. Do whatever the hell you want and it's awesome ♥

It's really strange though. It's like the first 20 minutes of this movie are directed differently(probably for that "first 5 minutes" trailer) and it really tries to put you off from sticking around to watch the rest of it, but _its like that one asteroid movie_ where the people get better at playing their parts later in the movie. It's really fun to see how horrible the first chapter of the movie is compared to the final 30 minutes, and even the music direction is different.
(p.s. sadly, nothing like this trailer music, which is absent. making the trailer theme of this upload total bullshit)

The big problem with this movie is that it tries to make everything uncanny instead of just letting go of the source material and replacing the more outlandish stuff with what will work _in real life_. The yellow-spandex effect and "YourCostumeNeedsWork" tropes in full effect. If you can't go for the fancy noir undertones and jazz pieces that the source materials liked using, try some other thematic setup. Just not  **the exact opposite** and this movie would've been way cooler

final edit: The amnesia thing I complained about... It's actually done pretty well. :D

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: The biggest issue I had with the movie was the lack of the Puppet Master and the philosophy of our point of existing as in the original. All we got from this movie was "Memories don't define you." Okay, cool. What happened to the, "What is consciousness? Who are we to say a being or species is not conscious or self aware when it would be so hard for another species or being to figure out that we are. Why are we self-aware? Is there meaning to it or accidental? Is reproduction our way of immortality? But passing on our genetic pool as far as that bloodline will take us? Is a part of our consciousness put into each person we 'create'? Are we all one single consciousness that has branched out since the beginning of mankind?" I was really hoping, with this movie reaching such a wider audience, that it would use something at least similar to the Puppet Master's speech to try and turn that little switch on in people's brains. One that makes people possibly more self aware than they want to be for that moment in time. I remember the speech so much from the original that I saw when I was 16, and it had such an impact on me. It made me take a step back at the bigger picture on a nearly daily basis. Which is honestly a bit scary but I do wish more people did it. It's such a shame they didn't stick to the puppet master and bring the same philosophy into it that made the original such a classic to begin with.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I think it's about time Scarlett Johansson showed us her acting chops if she has any. This is yet another role where she jumps around and acts dumb and she is beginning typecast herself with superhero /sci-fi roles.
I would love to see her do something with a little substance, .
Ghost in the Shell is set in the future in which humans and technology have begun to merge, a cybernetically enhanced soldier hunts a mysterious terrorist who can hack into his victims' minds and control their thoughts and memories. Her pursuit eventually leads her to discover the full truth about her past.I wasn't surprised to read Ghost in the Shell was adapted from a Japanese Manga series from the 80's as it has that fantastical feel about it. Fantastical not fantastic.
It also has the feel of a video game which is perhaps why it didn't do too much for me. The first 45 minutes bored me silly but thankfully the last hour was much better.
Good special affects and fine performance from underrated actor Pilou Asbæk still won't have me queuing up for any more in what is quite obviously going to be a new franchise. 6 out of 10

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
lil opinion from me.
i watched the movie.
i watched the anime.

soo i can say kinda tell em apart.

the movie is actually REALLY well done.
its something that bashes away the audience with an experience they actually put to good use.

sure, hollywood ruined some anime's
BUT this one? its actually VERY well done.

Scarlett Johansson is in my opinion a very good fitting person for the role.
at first i was scared the movie would ruin it.
but no it actually didnt.

sure the movie played with the original GitS story.
but it wasnt horrible.

*** SPOILERS!!!! SKIP IF YOU DONT WANT TO READ IT ****

the anime ends up with major getting onto the net, and gets out of her body.
she helps batou in the second anime movie with the puppet master.
not gonna tell more about it.

the Hollywood version ends up with a diffirent ending!
she.. shit well i said spoilers!
she ends up alive and keeps going with her team.
she lives and the ''puppet master'' aka in this movie one of the test subjects for a ''ghost in the shell''.

**** SPOILERS ENDED****

NOW! what can i say?
the hollywood version is a little dumbed down, sinds it does explain a LOT, of the story in a good way.
its a great movie imo.

in the sense of understanding a storyline without knowing it, searching the puzzles pieces yourself.
anyway.

conclusion.
watch the movie, both of em. 
i recommend it.

now, have fun watching both of em.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Having seen the movie I am actually okay with how it was written it stands as a decent movie (50-60 tomatoes).  Some elements felt like a prequel which I found interesting but should not have been a main story point.  I understand the obsession with origin stories but they had not established GiTS on film so I think it was a little too hollywood to try to build in context for the major like that.  They retained enough of the OVA to use the title but I believe they can do better and totally expect a reboot in the next few years (like they did with "The Hulk" vs "The Incredible Hulk", for example).  Some movies don't need it (like Total Recall, which was perfectly cheesy, although I'll never turn down Kate Beckinsale on any medium)

Did the producers and director think that the public wouldn't relate to this movie without some kind of love story?  Did they need to humanize the Major so much?  Subtlety is lost on this production.  They should have allowed some interpretation.  It's okay to have "Rosebud" elements to provoke thought in the audience.  Part of the charm of GiTS was that you wouldn't relate to it by default. Sci-Fi is meant to explore the futuristic and surreal potential of humanity.  See anything written by Asimov or Clarke.  We deserve thought provoking movies that don't try to fill in all the blanks for us.  There are no unanswered questions in this film and that is disappointing.

Actually, it would have benefited from a lower budget.

Comment:
I watched the movie tonight with my brother and we were amazed. The movie is pure epicness, deserves way more success. Loved it how they had so many Scenes which were like poppet out of it´s Anime. Gonna watch it again. How Major showed emotions, proves that every human has his/her own way to deal with pain. I loved the bond between Major and Batou (I loved Batou, his actor fit perfectly for the character). I recommend this movie to everyone, it´s epic and legendary, will make you question about what makes us really human. This is so important, especially in a time where people are sexualised (especially women) and objectified in the West, where people are valued and judged based on their body and looks.
And really, Johansson´s acting was amazing. And there´s no "white-washing" when the audience is mostly white people. If Japanese people had done this work for a japanese audience, you think they would have Major and the others look white? The audience is mostly white and the characters don´t look japanese at all.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I don't agree with the explicit internal dialogue concerning her origin.  In the OVA it was implied that Motoko was basically a human consciousness in a mechanical body. How she got there was never explored in the OVA.  I do love their adherence to some of the key scenes.  But I do not understand why they haven't mentioned the puppetmaster (project 2501) in the trailer so that makes me question how much does this movie follow the OVA? How much creative freedom was taken with this film?  The best parts of the OVA were questions about what makes an AI sentient, what makes a human human, can a machine have a spirit, Motoko's journey through her own existence and her ultimate conclusion, etc.  I feel like most of that might not be in this film.  I can't wait to see it, don't get me wrong but of all the adaptations and reboots that I've seen this one causes me the most anxiety and its strange.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
It wasn't very good honestly. There were things it did well and some recreated scenes from the original were done pretty well BUT the context is completely screwed up so the scenes don't work as well. And yeah, it's taken away a lot of the thought provoking themes of the original. I'll say this though, it's the best live action Hollywood film based on an anime so far. I mean, look at things like Dragon Ball Evolution and Speed Racer, this is clearly a better product than those. But it's still not great. This was a risky movie for them to make because outside of the anime community, Ghost in the Shell wasn't exactly a popular source for them to remake. It's just a shame they focused on the less important parts of the story. 


And I'm choosing not to comment on the whole white Major thing.

Comment: I saw this today and it was fuckin awesome. Totally payed respect to the original anime so for the idiots who just felt this need to boycott it because of this "whitewash" crap or whatever you call it, you missed out on a great movie. You missed out on a great movie because of your pettiness and inability to just focus on the movie rather than the color of the skin of the lead actress, ScarJo was awesome as Major btw and the perfect choice to play her. People have been doing this for years and it's not just "whitewashing" as some would have you believe. Fanboys complained when Samuel L. Jackson was cast as Nick Fury when he's white in the comics and they complained when Will Smith, another black man was cast as Deadshot. Both Samuel L. Jackson and Will Smith were great in the roles and I could care less about the color of their skin. Scarlett was great here too as the major but because the color of her skin wasn't quite right for fanboys they stupidly ignored it and missed out. I couldn't care less what the color of your skin is, if you're good in the role then that's all I need and Scarlett Johansson was damn good in the role. This whitewashing crap and complaining about a characters skin, including Jackson and Smith, in every movie actually contributes more to racism in this country because doing stuff like bitching about the characters skin color brings racism to the forefront again when we're trying to all be equal. People are so stupid that they don't even realize that in Ghost in the Shell it's just a body, it's just a shell, the girl, the soul is an Asian girl which the new movie explained. People need to just get over shit sometimes and just enjoy a good movie because I guarantee all of you morons who wanna "boycott" ghost in the shell because of "whitewashing" as soon as you see this movie someday whether it be on Blu Ray or just on TV someday you'll realize how ignorant you were for ignoring this movie for such a petty stupid reason. Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I saw it in theaters and it was amazing. The visuals and soundtrack were beautifully paired to create an atmospheric world. The deeper meanings were present and were more of an updated version of previous answers offered. The story is complex enough to stand above generic sci-fi films but not convoluted or confusing. The various symbolic undertones smoothly intertwine with the main story, creating a fascinating film. The film itself has less philosophy than the 1995 anime, but there is some present. The characters are not cardboard cutouts; they're developed and walk a blurred line between right and wrong and their motivations are complex. Scarlett Johansson was incredible as an actress in this role, and helps add emotional connection to the fleshed out Motoko Kusanagi character.

The only noticeable flaws were a with pacing and with a few simplistic dialogue moments. The trailer presented a more simplistic film than the film itself. Other than that, I say it's worthy of theater admission price.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I just saw it and was very satisfied.  Don't worry, I won't talk about spoilers.  I think the anime and film compliment each other very well.  The film answers questions that the anime leaves unanswered and vice versa.  Some critics said the film has an incomprehensible plot and lacked heart. These critics must have never seen or cared for the original. Because I found nothing difficult to understand in the plot and I actually think the film had more feeling and emotion than the anime. Only because the actors are real humans and could express emotion naturally.  

While I liked the new score,  I prefer the original score.  Also, the film is rated PG-13, so of course the violence was severely toned down from the anime.  These are my only complaints of the film.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
The Major does not act in response to her body. Whatever actions she would react to would be the result of her mental capacities. With the introduction of a means for the mind to travel through the net.  Any potential for body and mind to be interwoven together indefinitely is destroyed. Following this train of thought we run into concepts that sum up descartes in it's entirety. 

The very notion of “I think therefore I am” is the basis for Motoko’s reasoning. That she must be something however her reasoning takes it a step further.  Which denotes that memories are something that makes up an individual. So that while she may have artificial parts. She has memories that are unique to her. 

While she seemingly has the free will of thought and decision. It is only given to her when she fulfills her purpose in the company. She aids in fighting criminal hackers within Section 9. But the moment she decides to give up fulfilling such a task she will be terminated. This also leads me full circle to the idea that our lives are shaped by death. 

However the whole idea that Ghost in the Shell was a revenge story is a hack in itself. There no conspiracy theory here as it doesn't exist. That's just Hollywood's way of giving us the middle finger. Visually speaking the movie looks pretty good but that's about the only good thing I can say about it.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
7/10

Pros
-It FELT like Ghost in the Shell
-Included more iconic scenes than I expected
-Johansson managed to pull it off imo
-Over all rather enjoyable

Cons
-The conspiracy was VERY shallow
-Ending was too tied up for GITS; it felt empty, the weakest aspect, id almost call it butchery
-Memories. By the end they made her more human, when in the original she evolved beyond human
-'Making of Cyborg' WAS ONLY PLAYED IN CREDITS :'(

Comment:
I'm deliberately not going to watch the anime movie before this because I'm sure I might find it 'disappointing' for not sticking to the source material or whatever. I want to judge the movie in it's own right. Sticking to source material doesn't mean that the adaption will be any good. 

GiTS is well loved by anime fans but it might tank to a general audience, I mean who knows? I'm sure these guys considered sticking to sources in pre-production and whatnot but decided to have some originality as well - we'll see. If I don't end up liking the movie then it probably isn't that great of a movie. As someone who hasn't watched the original movie this trailer has still really got me interested in seeing it in theatres, so yeah I'm confident I won't be that bad.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I dunno... while I recognize the scenes from the anime (like the fight in the water) I get the feeling it is nowhere near that. Like that "bad guy" reminds you hard of the hacker in the anime as well, but the story seems to be wayyy personal. I miss her cold analysing cyborg feel. Like in the anime you see a woman but it is pretty clear she ain't human. She lacks typical human behaviour because from a pure logical point of view it doesn't make sense to be like that. Lots of small things, like the facial expresion being mostly the same, not blinking, turning around with a mechanical movement, not as fluent as the human coworkers.... 

And I AM aware the manga also featured a more humanesque Motoko, giving ground for an argument about this movie being closer to the actual source (manga), but the anime cyborg was so, SO good. I would've loved her to be like that instead of this obvious human version. I mean even the plastic face geisha there is blinking... wtf. :\

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I've been hearing a lot of negatives on this movie because they got Scarlett Johansson to play the main character instead of an Asian woman. They are calling it white washing. Look, I know that there are some shameful/disgusting ignoring/disrespect of ethnicity that goes on in Hollywood like having a predominantly white cast for movies of Egypt (a place in Africa) and other things like that, but I have to say that I don't see it here. The main character on the Ghost in the Shell anime actually looks more like Scarlett Johansson than any Asian woman I've seen. It is not like in something like Exodus: Gods and Kings or Gods of Egypt. And I am not an anime fan or anything, but a lot of the anime characters look nothing like people we consider Asian. It'd be like if someone had a character named Lee Chin in an animated film and he was a tall man with dark brown, chocolate-like skin with a lean, muscular build. You can't really blame people for choosing Michael B. Jordan to play that character in a live action movie.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
People here are complaining about the looks and ethnicity of the main character. I'm more wondering about whether the content of the film will be just as good and intriguing. The trailer gives more of a crime action vibe than a psychological thriller and philosophical one. Though I do like how they've done the cyberpunk aspect in this.

The philosophy behind the original film was among the best aspects of it for me. The questions raised, the self-reflection and the deep discussions that took place. So many great things about the original and i'm more so wondering how they will carry it out in the film and whether it'll be as interesting, deep and thought provocative. So i'll reserve judgement until after i've seen it, otherwise i'm more cautious about it appearing more action-like than anything. But then again trailers are known to do that with films like this.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
"No no no, bad bad bad, wrong wrong wrong."

I enjoy Miss Johansson as an actress but the Major is Japanese. So are Batou, Chief Aramaki, Togusa, Ichikawa and the Tachikoma. The setting is high-tech but there are many episodes that clearly state that the country is Japan. The relationship between technology and Section 9 is Japanese in a time when Japan was cutting-edge of the entire technological market. The Internet was a scary place in 1995 and the concept of the hackers was new and frightening. The manga debuted in 1989. 

The Japanese name of this show is not "Busty Skin-Suit Heroine". It's "Mobile Armored Riot Police" and the Major heads up an elite police squad that even has trouble staying active among the legitimate police squad and military. They're the elite of the elite (Batou's an ex-ranger) and that's why they can afford cybernetic prosthetic upgrades. Section 9 willfully signs away their professional lives and all their time and the enhancements are a free perk for the commitment. Otherwise they're next to impossible to maintain. There is no amnesia plot in the series. Section 9 tracks Laughing Man in season one and handles Comrade Kuze in season two.

Go on KissAnime and watch the 1995 animated film (dubbed or subbed) before you say anything positive about this tripe. Kusanagi faces and merges with a superhacker and never gains amnesia. I couldn't even sit through this trailer. I stopped it after 36 seconds because seeing Miss Johansson in that outfit makes me want to claw out my eyes. Not only is she not Japanese; she is not Major Kusanagi.

Comment: First reaction: this looks amazing. And I love the '95 anime. Yes, there's a little whitewashing. But you could do a lot worse. Who you gonna cast? Name a Japanese actress right now that looks more like Motoko, and is a better actress than Scarlette. And she does kinda look like her; all I'm sayin. Batou looks awesome. And Beat Takeshi is the Section 9 chief. So it's not thaaat bad. The white actresses/actors they picked are solid too. Michael Pitt's voice alone, damn. I'm so sick of these source material snobs. I'm a sci-if/action movie fan first and foremost. And this looks really good. No matter what some hardcore anime fans are gonna hate.(Ninja Scroll is the GOAT anyway so save it). They're probably the same people that say the song of ice and fire books are better than GoT. No they're fu$&ing not. This looks sweet; give it an effing chance.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I know this is a weird critique but why isn't she nude for real? 

I have no desire of seeing the actress nude, it's the character, one of Major's greatest point is how she had this beautiful body but she (gender based of her body not her consciousness) had no social constructs attached to it. For her it was just a shell for her ghost nothing else, but her surrounding did not feel the same way since they are human.

I think it would have been kind of groundbreaking to really show a new type of lifeforce living within one of us, to force the audience stop looking at the body from a sexual or shameful point of view, but I hope they will successfully weave the fundamental threads of the original GITS without it.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I think Claire Redfield- Ali Larter- from the Resident Evil movies might have been a much better Major than Scarlett Johansson.  I think she's got more of the athletic chops, and also the better type of charisma for the character, and even the overall better physical look.  Not perfect, but she's more in the right direction.  I think on the downside, she might be the less talented actress (but does that matter much when the more talented actress happens to be doing the role wrong?).  I'll have to see the movie, though.  Also, she would be a good Star Wars actress based on the Claire Redfield character.  I've been trying to put my finger on what's wrong with Scarlett Johansson, and I think Ali Larter has the answer.

Reading the comments it seems all the fanboys are getting their knickers in a twist that the main character isn't Asian but, in basic terms, had they cast a Japanese actress as opposed to an established A List actress, they may have struggled in their attempts to attract a wider audience and non-fanboys. At the end of the day, they want as many people to see and enjoy their film as possible as that directly correlates to increased profit. If they made a pure 100% carbon copy film from the source material this film may have only been watched by the for talk's sake 1 million fans of the anime. As before stated I don't like Anime and for that reason I never watched Attack on Titan live action. This however I will give a watch.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: This may be all style and little substance. May be destined for the $3.99 bin at Best Buy. They are trying to make a niche movie into a mainstream movie meaning a dumbed down version with big stars, explosions, and too much slo mo. I think this idea would have come off better under a foreign studio which would focus more on the story and less on trying to make it a blockbuster. Now that Marvel and DC are starting to cool off, live action anime might be the new flavor. I also don't think Akira will come off well as a live action feature because of the fact that it is the art and not its bloated story that makes Akira stand out. When you talk to anyone about Akira, they talk about the animation, not the story. What makes anime like these great is the fact that they don't look real, but are extremely well drawn. It's this distance that makes them appealing. Live action will take away from the art and draw more attention to the story which is not bad if the stories are well written. But looking at how much money went into the look of this trailer I doubt that it's counterbalanced with a well written script. This may go the way of Aeon Flux when all is said and done,

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Most actions scenes seem to be right out of the original anime (1995) which I'm happy to see. But what I'm really interested in is if the plot will sort of fix the lose ends that the anime had. They were minor and practically didn't take away from the experience, but they were there. As for the whole 'discovering who I am' stuff, I don't know how that fits. I mean it was never fully clear if Major merged with the Puppeteer or not in the 1995 anime, but she knew who she was and what she lacked. Maybe they'll use the merge part (if it's in the movie) to tie in the 'discovery' plot. That is if there is a Puppeteer as the main villain and not the company who created her. (Which now thing about it, created the villain as well). Because of that they could make Major and the villain friend/enemies, but I don't know how I feel about that since they were never on the same side. The visuals are beautiful though and I"m liking how they stayed with her 'naked' costume. Sure a bit more white, but it seems to work, at least in the trailer. Here's hoping its actually good, because both anime and manga were awesome! (Just as an off note I'm referencing things based solely on the 1995 anime, so if things were explained in the original manga or the TV show, I wouldn't know since I haven't read/seen those.)

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
The costume design looks incredible - though I'm assuming the visuals will be the only good thing about this - I have a feeling they're going to cram two or three different movies into one, which could end as a huge disappointment.  Call me weird, but I also thought shying away from nudity only devalues the purity of what Major is.  

Frankly, in the end I think that the story from Ex Machina will lowkey tell a better story of what Major's existential conflict is truly about than this film.  But we will see.  Also wished they made her wear blue contacts or something... idk can't judge it yet, but I'm already prepared to be disappointed lol

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Does is honestly matter that much to you guys? I understand the problem when a white actor is cast to play a character who's ethnicity is relevant to the character's identity or in some way to the plot.. But that's not really the case here is it? There isn't a lot "Japanese" about the Major, there are however Japanese elements in the show (mostly in the aesthetics of the world they live in) and by the looks of it they are staying true to that.. So I don't really understand the issue.

In fact I'm a little disappointed they didn't just move the setting from Japan to Hong Kong or New York. That's what Niihama is originally based on to begin with.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
+Gordon Graham
"There are white Japanese now, and not just a few of them."
Yes there are just a few of them. All research I ever read on the subject points to single-digit percentages of recent non-Japanese ancestry among the Japanese population, and of those, the majority are actually Asian (e.g. Korean, Chinese, Filipino etc.)
Anecdotally, when I lived in Japan, the number of 'white' people in most locales was... well I was usually the only one. Of course you are going to meet many at cultural centers or events which specifically cater to Western-descended people, as did I - but that is hardly representative of the whole.

A movie set in *modern-day* Japan where all the main characters are white would rightfully be laughed/booed out of the room for being terribly whitewashed as well as preposterous. No one would swallow the excuse that in the novel of manga source set in 2016 Tokyo it wasn't specified that the characters weren't all white, so they just might be all white. It would be ridiculous in how unrepresentative it is. This GitS movie gets away with it (or rather the makers think it will) because the near future setting gives them a flimsy BS excuse, that's all.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Hope to god! this movie turns out great. Haven't read any of the Manga but love the Anime stuff, the original movie of course, Its sequel, both seasons of Stand Alone Complex and its movie Solid State Society. I even quite enjoyed the spinoff show Arise. But I'm really doubtful for this Hollywood effort, can see it going the same way as all those terrible movies based off video games went.
Have no problem with Scarlett as the Major, may not have been top of my list but she is a good actress, and has experience doing action these days. The people screaming "whitewash" need to realize, big studios won't take gambles on so called "unknowns" or little known foreign talent with their big expensive blockbusters, they want the big! names in the leading roles of their big! films. That's just the way Hollywood works I'm afraid, at least Takeshi Kitano is in the cast.

Comment: Hollywood should watch the original russian movie Stalker to get the idea how to make a good sci-fi. Too many "epic scenes", too many explosions and too many fancy special effects. I have pretty much ignored virtually every sci-fi movie for like last decade, because they all seem to focus on feeding your mind with millions of details containing scenery and huge supercomplex special effects. Bigger is not always better! Showing less leaves more to the human wonder and imagination. Thats why Staliker is still very powerful movie!

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I don't understand the hate here. You cannot Asians for an anime, since the cartoons doesn't even look Asian -They have round eyes and look much more European. Also, if we look at the cast, it's nothing but brilliant. Scarlett Johansson has proven herself as an actress, and also in action movies -She can carry out those fight-scenes. Then we have underrated Pilou Asbæk supporting her, and he is rising a rising star in Game of Thrones, so I think he will do a great job in this as well. Furthermore, I rarely like the anime adaptions. Dragon Ball sucked, and Kickass was just about average. But this trailer shows that they have focused a lot on the story here, and less on making it look like the comic -Which is what is needed for this to be a succesful adaptation. Im looking forward to this movie, no doubt :)

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I have to say, I never knew about the anime or manga until after seeing this trailer. I've looked into the anime/manga and can't believe I've missed out on it for this long. As someone who is always weary now a days when films of cherished franchises are turned into movies in which they tend to ruin the sense of nostalgia and originality, I'm not worried about this movie. So far by the trailer it looks like it'll be good. Again only judging by this trailer it looks like this will respectively portray the anime in its own medium and do well. Kind of how I both enjoy the Lord of the Rings movies and the books. I don't feel the movies took away but in their own way were brilliantly done well. I hope this movie can do the same. Have hope people! Don't be too quick to criticize.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Same comments over and over again here...Look, name me ONE Japanese actress if you're in the U.S. Go. Couldn't think of one, could you? Right. And if you could, guess what? She's not a Hollywood A-lister. She's not even a "D Lister" (maybe that girl from Memoirs of a Geisha, let's say...). Fanboys may go to see a movie because its adapted from something they love. Everyone else goes to see one movie over another because they like the actor/director, the trailer looks good, or it got good reviews. Scarlett Johansson has proven her top billing status and acting ability. That's why she was chosen for the role. If the only people that go see this movie are fanboys, it won't make enough for them to make another movie like this one. And if you look at the how the character looks in the anime, she looks just like her. 

Making Shredder from TMNT William Fichner, I could understand those complaints because it completely changed the story. But this, c'mon. You're just looking for something to complain about, and while you do so, you make filmmakers afraid to take risks and deviate from the source material. Meanwhile, most of you can't create your way out of a paper bag. You just excel at complaining.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
This looks, not good. Let me explain: I know they're copying scenes from the 1995 movie and all that, but at least make them useful and benifical to the plot. These scenes look like they're purely just there for nostalgia. And the fight scenes look to Matrix-y. Ghost in the shell is more tatical.
The philosohy doesn't always revolve around the Major, nor does the fact that the Major seems vurnrable, or always confused about her past. In the 1995 movie, she wonders how much of her humanity is stripped away, and how much of a robot she is. It's not like she has amnesia in the original movie, nor is wonderd who she really is. she doesn't really care, she wonders how much of her is left. She never had her life stolen or whatever. She was rescued and she chose to join the police force. Oh and she's Japanese. Kuze is Japanese too. Watch 2nd GIG.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Although I do understand the disdain for Ghost In the Shell having an 
Non-Asian lead, I do feel those who choose to not see the film will 
ultimately hinder Asian actor's ability to get better roles. The very 
fact that we are going to see a classic Anime live action adaptation in 
less than three months is ground breaking. Anime has fought hard to make
 its way into pop culture. I remember visiting my local mall's Sundance 
store. It was the only store that carried Anime. I also remember 
becoming hooked on films like Ghost in the Shell, Akira, Venus Wars, and
 Ninja Scroll. I found these films because some one chose to mention 
them in a magazine or some other form of media I was into at the time. 
And although I was too young to appreciate them fully, I became a fan. 
Now fast forward to 2017 and we have a 150 million dollar adaptation of 
one of these classics of the 90s. It's progress. It may not be 100% what
 we want but its a start. If Anime are to be celebrated by the masses 
you need to have mass appeal. Charlotte brings that to the table. No one
 who is not a Geek of Anime or movies knows what this movie is. What 
will bring them to theaters is their interest in the trailer and the 
lead actress. If we can get them watching, then we can then more live 
action Anime. And if we introduce more Anime we can begin casting more 
Asian actors into the roles. Marvel is in the process of bringing comics
 to the main stream in the same fashion. Who ever thought we would see 
so many characters brought to life on the big screen. We have mainstream
 audiences to thank for that, not just the enthusiast. One day I hope 
comics will be considered accessible by everyone. And I also hope that 
of Anime. So, I beg you, if you are fan of Anime please see this film. 
The more people who do, the more reasons to make other adaptations. 
Boycotting the movie will cause more harm than good. So GO SEE Ghost In 
The Shell! :)

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: The movie looks pretty good. The visuals of the city landscapes look fantastic! I know a lot of people complain that the major isn't being played by an Asian, but honestly, all ethnicity aside, Scarlet Johansson does seem like the right kind of person to play the major. Besides, one of the hole ideas from the original anime was that her character wasn't in her original body, but rather in a mass-produced assembly line body built by a big corporation, so I think it could still work with having Scarlet Johansson playing her, in terms of story and what not. The biggest thing that I don't like in this trailer is how Batou looks. He was one of my favorite characters from the original anime(in particular, the second anime film "inesense"). I like the guy they got to play him, but His eye lenses are way too small and just look kind of weird the way they did them. Also there were some scenes where he had normal looking eyes in the trailer, which he never had in any of the anime versions. Hopefully the rest of the movie is adapted pretty faithfully. I looked up the "shelling sequence" scene which they did for this movie and it looked amazing! It was about as perfect as they could have adapted that scene. They even had the same music from the anime film. So I don't know. Hopefully this will be a good film. I'll defiantly see it when it comes out.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I know people are mad about Johansson being Major, but this actually doesn't look that bad. I'm a huge GitS fan, will never forget seeing it on a big projector in the back of this cool video rental place. I was about 8-9 and it was somewhere around 97-98, I had just finished playing my half brothers copy of Metal Gear Solid on playstation. That game was and still is my favorite video game. When I saw GitS on the projector it was the end scene where Major is fighting the tank, it look JUST like Metal Gear Solid except with some hot cyborg replacing Snake :D I fell in love. Both of those series just have so much atmosphere in their worlds, and sense of realism. 

P.S It Seems like Cyber Punk is kind of coming back, interested to see if we ever get an Akira hollywood film, then there's the new Blade Runner as well as Cyber Punk 2077(I haven't played any of that dev's games, but have heard good things. I got my medevil magic fill with dark souls). 

^NERD!!!

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Extremely disappointed with this. At first I got quite hyped with the visual but then I heard the premisse for the Major's character: "I'm looking for who I am", "I'm insecure, I don't know who to trust". This sounded ridiculously shallow and cheesy. Really hope there is more depth to that. 
 
They could have gone for many different approaches for the Major; 

Oshii's: A dark slightly depressed but deep intelectual and introspective woman, clearly detached from her humanity but still with desires to dive deep into the mysteries of the new world she lives in and the nature of life. 

Shirow's Original Major: A tough "gorila babe" with a sarcastic but wit sense of humor that fights for justice and has a difficult time getting herself a strong man that can handle her, so she still has some lesbian fun with some youger friends of hers. Much more like a young tough but humorous "female detective". 

Or Kamiyama's Major: Kinda of a mix of the two, a mysterious extremely intelligent and talented character with a little bit of sarcasm spiced with no problem in showing her sexiness, still she wonders about the nature of the ghosts and her own identity but in her own mature adult away.

All three Majors share a common trait: She is a strong independent woman. THE LAST THING I'D EXPECT TO SEE IN MAJOR IS INSECURITY! Her identity crisis is that more of a mid aged woman, definetely NOT of an endgy insecure teenager. 

That seems like a really shallow generic main character. Seems to me hollywood still can't take Japanese animation (and manga) seriously enough. This is not catering to the adult audience fan of GITS that first saw this back in the late nights, but to dumb millennium teenagers.

Chopping key components of the story, and the death stroke of using Michael Pitt will be the demise of this film. Shame.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I really want this movie to be good but I have nothing but ill will at the moment. The biggest red flag for me has nothing to do with Scarlett playing the Major(Lets make it straight as well that she never calls herself the Major but Kusanagi) but its the visuals, visuals play a HUGE role in movies and they shot themselves in the foot, the background is sooo distracting, and you can make the argument they did it to draw in the audience but to me as someone who's a avid fan its painful. Also the Major is not the first full body prosthetic. As a matter of fact there are several of them even in the first movie.

Note: This part was made after watching the trailer.

The Major knows who she is! She didn't lose her past, theres a bit about becasue she lost her original body she feels like she's lost her original ghost but thats it. Ugh I hate movie trailers like this.

One last note before I wrap up. Batou! No! He's ghastly!

I hope the best for this movie, and its going to make its money, what I hope is that it'll get people watching the original Ghost in the Shell.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
1) Looks creative.
2) The trailer smells of fear from the producers. They're trying too hard. It's like "hey teen boys... look she's naked and kissing another girl... buy a damn ticket!" While at the same time trying too hard to show iconic scenes from the original. 
3) The original is one of my all time favorite anime. It was almost profetic in describing social media and how we will interact in the future. Major is a character that lets you explore that world. This however feels (at least the trailer made it seem that way) that her past will be an important plot point. That feels a little too cliché and overdone, whereas the original was more about exploring a future world and what it means to be alive. 
4) This is not to say the movie doesn't look appealing or that I'm not looking forward to it. I'm just saying from the trailer it looks like the makers are too focused on it's success and targeting audiences that I get a feel like some of what made the anime fun might be lost. Again obviously it's all speculation. 
5) Best I can say about it is the look and SJH seems alright in the role.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Looks good. 
And there goes random screw ups big and small:
- Cliche "wall running"... Also the second guy brave heroine shoots while "wall running" should've emptied like half of the magazine right in her wherever really, but screenwriters saved the day.
- "You were dying - we saved you" cliche crap.
- WTF with "you are the first of your kind"!? In "source materials" - she got her full synth body when she was just a kid and by the time it happened, this sort of practice was already relatively common. And here you're trying to pitch it as if we're watching RoboCop. Also "one of a kind" cliche...
- 1:25 - I'd start blaming screenwriters - Chief Aramaki took a gun in his hands like once in whole Ghost In The Shell animated movie/series and/or manga universes and here he takes out a death squad with just 6 shots... But it's Takeshi Kitano - what else would you expect?...
- 1:30 - I'll just assume that you forgot to add the "eye implants" for Bato's character there. Also I got the feeling - somebody forgot about the fact that he has full synthetic body just like Major Kusanagi does.
- 1:34 - and that's where Motoko's motivation goes out of the window, right into hollywoods graveyard of cliche motivations.
- 1:48 - Ok. That's just sad. I really hope that guy was  not "The Laughing Man" character. Also another grave stone on hollywood cliche hero origins graveyard.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Everything looks beautiful and the acting is great, but only one thing has partly ruined this adaptation for me and that's the sensitivity and soft tone of voice that Scarlett Johansson has. She has too much of a soft voice and mellow personality to suit Motoko Kusanagi. Motoko has a very wild and strong personality, also her eyes defined her greatly. Motoko's death stare and serious expression were one of the characteristics that defined her as a very unique character in the cyberpunk era and Scarlett doesn't seem like she will be delivering that to us. Trembling while holding a gun?! I know it's an adaptation of the puppet master but watch the Sniper episode with Pazu and Motoko in Stand Alone Complex.... that's my interpretation of the original Motoko!  It's such a bummer....

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Strangely, I'm finding Johanssons' voice really disturbing in this. 

I like Johansson, but after years of GITS, SAC, etc, I'm too used to strong voice actresses playing the part. The major has a strong, clear voice which nicely represents her cool self-assuredness and military experience. Put simply, The Major is a bad ass. She has the voice of a military commander...

Johanssons' breathy whispering here just conveys doubt and uncertainty. I understand she's probably trying to convey exactly that, since she is going through a sort of existential crisis here, but its just out of character. Even when Kusanagi was at her most self-doubting phase, questioning the existence of ghost, she never sounded this wishy-washy. She attacked it like just another intellectual problem while tossing back a beer.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I think a lot of people are missing the point here and just fixating on the casting. Who cares. I just want someone who can play the role and understands the Major's proper lack of emotion and reasoning thereof; so seeing the Major crack a one-liner and slyly smile afterwards is already off-putting (not that GitS doesn't have some level of humor). Personally, the shape of Scar-Jo's face and the way that she acts, she shows emotion whether she means to or not. Can she step up? Maybe, hopefully. We all want a good movie so all we can do is hope that she can. I don't care what ethnicity that entails as long as they view the source material and do it right. Instead, as it's a Hollywood movie that has to explain a ton of things to not alienate non-GitS viewers, shouldn't we be more concerned that introducing, understanding and coming to a conclusion in a two-hour film surrounding the complexity of the GitS universe is going to be one hell of an tough-to-achieve task?

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: At first I was very sketchy about this movie. Another Japanese classic tarnished by American Hollywood. But, I am pleased to say that this movie looks like it's going to be really good. I like Scarlett Johansson. I believe she does a great job in the films she has been in. I think the only two that would have placed in my mind that this one wouldn't make it were Under the Skin & Lucy. But, I always have to remind myself that I can't judge an actor/actresses' performance solely on them; because they are led by a director. And that 1 or 2 flops (in my eyes) doesn't speak for that person's entire career. Overall, I am really looking forward to this movie and what Hollywood and the actors can bring to the table. Please, don't let me down.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
seems significantly dumbed-down when compared with the original movie and the sac show. the plot seems more like your generic super spy with amnesia a la jason bourn. also seems like they sucked out all of the subtlety of motoko's character. 
the visuals seem accurate enough but simply wearing the skin of a good movie doesn't make you good. 
nice that they kept her orientation the same. 
not fond of them making motoko the six million dollar woman. if I remember correctly motoko was not the only full body cyborg nor were they some kind of secret. motoko was exceptional due to her hacking prowess and exceptional piloting skill (piloting the cyber-body) as well as good leadership skills, not because she was the only person in the world to be given super powers. that's more like the plot from ghost urn then ghost in the shell. not every protagonist has to be a singled out chosen one hero especially since that makes it seem like the character is only good because they were given the best toys rather then because they posses any real skill or intellect.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: If you prefer the anime and manga so much just go watch/read them. They haven't gone anywhere. Personally I like the direction they are going with this. I don't want it to be the same as the series or the animated movie, I want it to be unpredictable and for it to bring new food for thought to the table. That's what Ghost in the Shell is and always has been, thought provoking and raising potential issues in future society. Surely you'd be disappointed if it was the same concepts explored again and again. Try to remember guys that this may be someone's first look at the GITS universe and could spur more writers to explore it in new and interesting ways whilst broadening the audience, that's got to excite you; potentially having more people to talk to about this amazing story.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I've never seen people get this upset over ''whitewashing'' in hollywood before. If you really think there's some racist conspiracy to keep non-white actors out of movies you're an idiot. Movie studios only care about money, so they'll chose a well-known white actress over an unknown Asian actress any day. NOT because they hate asians, but because they're selling a movie to a western market and there aren't very many well known Asian actors to begin with, mostly because they make up such a small percentage of the US population. I know it's easy to yell ''RACISM'' every time something like this happens, but next time maybe actually consider there are tons of factors that can influence casting choices.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I watched Ghost In The Shell 1995 movie for over 5 times already and I loved it. Motoko Kusanagi is really iconic character. One thing that scare and worry  is about 2017 live action movie and I am not really fan of choosing Scarlet as Motoko Kusanagi's role. Why? If u watch the 1995 movie closely, Motoko didn't make so much facial expression  but only obviously expression she made is that she was looking for the answers and she wanted to figure it out. Comment: I think I can comfortably say I watched a lot of anime having around 2.5k episodes on myanimelist. Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Do anime fans and asians honestly expect no one else to do live actions? Asian companies suck ass at making movies, just look at Attack on Titan and how god awful that was. 

I'd rather see my favorite animes come to life in Hollywood by white dudes, at least it won't suck (sometimes). American white washed animes aren't flopping due to the white washing, it's flopping because no one knows how to make a decent movie from an anime. Get a major studio, A-list actors, directors and writers to do it and it'll be amazing. As  it stands now, you have a bunch of B list studios,etc attempting to do animes because of existing fan bases in hopes of making money. This movie is pretty much the first live action anime with major players behind it.

Comment: I've read the manga and seen the anime.  The manga had a bigger story, but was a little drawn out.  The anime skipped a great deal of the exposition, but hit on the action.  However, both were intended for a mature audience, hence the nipples being human-like on both mediums.  This looks to be moving towards a PG-13 rating, which, despite Scarlet being the lead, makes me worried that American audiences will get the wrong idea of this masterfully written Japanese work and further the disdain by the un-informed audience of the greatness of such works.

Comment: Problem being, GITS was a very, well, intellectual series, that dealt with a lot of theoretical issues regarding trans-humanism, artificial intelligence, and societal changes in the wake of large scale cyber-ization. I'm sure the movie will LOOK great, SOUND great, and (hopefully) have a coherent plot, but this trailer gives off none of the 'feel', the 'soul' that Ghost had in almost all of its previous incarnations. Also, Batou doesn't look like Batou at all, haha, where's my old grizzled war vet!

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
This is going to suck, and nobody's pointing out the reason why; they're making it _about_ Motoko Kusanagi.

What made GitS great was that it was about two things: the philosophical and political ramifications of a world in which most people are cyberized (their nanomachine-infused brains are connected directly to the internet).  It tackled questions of identity, rights, and the ship of Theseus, while deconstructing the setting with brain-hacking counterterrorists solving cyber-crimes.  Any information we learned about Motoko along the way was _incidental_ because *THE STORY ISN'T ABOUT HER.*

Making it about her uncovering her past, and throwing in these cheesy one-liners, is Hollywood bullshit that is painting a great franchise into nothing more than "Kill Bill meets Robocop."

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I get why they couldn't do it, but I'm a little mad the Major isn't fully nude for at least the building jump. Both films played heavily on mind-body dualism, with sequences like the original, nude building jump really stating clearly that how people view prosthetic bodies is not how flesh-and-blood people view their own bodies. You can't be ashamed of a prosthetic. People have run in the Olympics and Para-Olympics with very abstract prosthetic leg designs that are as far from human as you can get. There's no attachment to an object, no shame. Even if you're inside it or rely on it. Hopefully they make up for it later in the film.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Now everybody is going to act as though they was into this before it became "popular" and that really sucks cause I'm so completely into GITS I own virtually everything from GITS. Some of the dialogue already is dumb in this movie, but as any TRUE fan since at least the GITS two anime seasons in mid 2000's can attest to, ScarJo was destined to play the Major since a live action was talked about way back when. And this isn't a joke or exaggeration, ScarJo has literally been the pick to play the Major all the way back then, ten years ago. But this movie is going to be dumbed down for the stupid shit majority public because a TRUE GITS movie is FAR too intelligent for 99% of the population to comprehend. Anyway I love GITS and let's give this movie a fighting chance.

Comment: Are y'all fools? This is the damn first trailer. Let them make it look exciting to draw the interest of people who aren't already fans! The fans are already interested in this movie they need to attract new viewers. They're being tactical. Most people would be drawn to a very exciting and action-centric trailer thus they made one. If they made the first trailer really philosophical less people would want to see the movie. And then if they made the 2nd trailer exciting then those people wouldn't bother because they've already lost interest. Although I am certain this movie will not be as philosophical and as incredible as the original, I'm still confident that they will keep the core themes running throughout the movie. It's simple...

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I sincerely hope that the details and the premise of the anime are upheld in this remake. The original film detailed some interesting revelations about the interface between humans and machines. Cybernetics, and consciousness, the defining characteristics on that field being moral dilemmas, and whose ultimate responsibility it was, the unsettling answer being that no one or thing knew. 

That's what made this film, and the subsequent series so comforting to watch, as, such issues are present today, in our everyday lives, yet we are unable to observe their effects on us as a beings living out of our mental projections, only within the mental framework of a dystopian future are we able to pick objectively at our own immortality. The answer once again, being that noone or thing has control, and this idea is made all the more startling when observed in the mind of a machine. 

The ideas behind the movie reference many an important philosophy, but, I think scientifically, as we stand today, theoretical neuroscience (a ways forward) and its understanding of the mind as a, ultimately, and, as far as the main points about it go, a learning machine, that, can, become a caveat for any who look nonchalantly at a humble stone axe made millennia ago by a bird, and objectively rely on the idea of a non-sentient accumulation at work. Because well simply, the mind of a machine is in the CPU right? well, you say, no, that's the brain. Then, dare I ask, what is the mind?

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
They pretty much changed the plot big time and totally lost the main "plot" of Ghost in the Shell (Ghost in the Machine -Arthur Koestler). The story was never about Kusanagi Motoko being a first of her kind. And it was also never about her trying to find her true identity because she already knew who she was. Also looking at the Trailer, they seem to have mashed up action scenes from both the 1995 Movie, and the TV series GITS:Stand Alone Complex (The intro where she jumped off from 1995 GITS and the android dolls taking diners as hostages from GITS Stand Alone Complex)... I highly doubt this live action can be as good as the Animation movies/series. If anything perhaps 20%-30% as good. The feel of the show (base on the trailer) is also dead since they started using their over sponsored shit music and not the one's Gabriela Robin uses (a.k.a. Yoko Kanno).

The main issue with creating a live action of an Animation such as Ghost in the Shell that have spawned several Movies, OVA's and Series that are very successful on their own is that the Bar was set very high by the Animations alone which is hard to beat. Specially harder to beat when you make a live action that have a big change in plot, mis-cast the characters and many more.

Unlike an example..  the  Manga and Novel "All you need is kill" it was a Manga and Novel that was not as well known as Ghost in the Shell, it was not animated even.. It was easy to make a movie out of it and become successful Without so much critics cause it was relatively not well known to many manga and Novel readers (I have read thousand's of manga titles  and I never heard of that manga until I finished watching Edge of Tomorrow.. that's how relatively Unknown that manga really is...). The "Manga and Novel All you Need is kill" = Live action movie is called "Edge of Tomorrow/Live-Die-Repeat".

But ye, for this Movie to be successful. They have to produce something that can be on par or overpass the quality the 1995 movie possess (but I don't think they can...) Unlike Edge of Tomorrow which proved to be very successful. 

Even Edge of Tomorrow did not 100% Follow the "All You Need is Kill" Manga and Novel faithfully, it had a heavily westernised casting, and a lot of things were changed in the story. But it was successful nonetheless cause that particular manga and Novel was not that well known/mainstream unlike Ghost in the Shell which is more popular and have high scores on the Animated Movie and Series (which this live action movie have to beat or say atleast get 50% as good). Either its going to be a flop or its the typical Hollywood Influence thing where it only gained huge box office cause a lot of people watched it = Mostly people who have no idea what Ghost in the Shell is and have yet to watch the Ghost in the Shell 1995 or the Series (Ghost in the Shell Stand Alone Complex Season 1 and 2, GITS:Innocence and many more).

I would say, if you plan on watching this live action, go watch the Ghost in the Shell 1995 atleast and perhaps Ghost in the Shell Stand Alone Complex Season 1 and 2 as well. And then Watch this trailer again. See the huge difference. (Just saying :P).

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
To what I see in the trailer they clearly missed the point what Masamune Shirow wanted to show in Ghost in the Shell. It looks like a typical holywood  action movie set in the future, with some kind of "they stole your identity" or "bad guys are actually good" plot twist, while the actual story of Ghost in the shell is about the definition  of having a soul (=Ghost) in an artificial body (=Shell) the contradiction in opposite manners and the value of a body (artificial or biological) to its soul or vice versa. Thats why its called: Ghost (your soul) in the Shell (the body). It goes far beyond some shooting scene and future backgrounds. 

The trailer gives me the impression, that they poorly executed the plot from the original story and simply took the settings to advertise their movie creating something for the "mass".
Yet again I do not think the movie has to be bad. Moreover I would say that the movie should not be called Ghost in the Shell  (as far my assumptions are correct) but simply "inspired" by what Masamune did. It deserve it`s own name, so it will not leave a bad aftertaste either, like the implementation of the Dragon Ball movie.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Proof that manga and anime are worth it. This adaptation looks amazing. I understand where people are coming from about the cast, even though i love Johansson. Simply because 'd love to see a Japanese actress have the main role for once and  the story comes from Japan, afterall. And at the same time, I think that thanks to ScarJo, the movie will have a better media coverage. Could have been the big reveal of an actress but that's only if people were interested enough to go see a movie adaptation of a manga/anime with an unknown cast... Gotta say, ScarJo's very stolid acting kinda fits the character from the 1995 animated movie (which is really different from the original manga character). So it was a bargain on the producer's side, you know. It's also part of the success of a movie, I guess. All in all, love the CGI work in there, the costumes and environments look great, the story is amazing and it's high  time they made an adaptation!

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I don't understand why people want the same thing as the books, original animes/cartoons, etc. I prefer a director to deviate a bit so that their take isn't like the original story made by someone else. That's their story work. If I wanted to read/watch the same thing I'd go back to the original every time. Its just silly to make a remake where you know every little detail. Let the director's tweak and change things so I can see their take on it.

When a music artist comes out with a song, another person makes a remix and uploads it on media like soundcloud or newgrounds that sounds similar but very different. Thats exactly how a director should act. People get so up tight in their tiny assholes about perfect adaptions of an original work. I just don't find paying for something I've already seen worth my time. Tweak it and tweak it liberally.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
For the people saying "they never specified her ethnicity" and "she's a cyborg"..

I wouldn't think you would need to specify ethnicity in an ANIME/MANGA, 
especially when her name is "Motoko Kusanagi" and it takes place in JAPAN 
(a place which 98% of people are indeed Japanese). In fact when they do specify ethnicity or race in an anime it's usually to let the audience know that they AREN'T of Japanese descent. 

***Most importantly to end this debate, she was supposed to be a generic looking model made to look inconspicuous and be able to blend into crowds so WHY WOULD SHE NOT BE MADE TO LOOK LIKE ALL THE OTHER JAPANESE PEOPLE IN THE CROWD??!?!?!?!

Would it really kill Hollywood to let an Asian-American play a lead role in a big film? When was the last time you saw an Asian play a lead role in a big American film (that wasn't a martial arts movie). People aren't "fake mad" just because of this role but at the fact that Asian-Americans are widely underrepresented in American film.

We all know they are casting a white person with a brand name to increase box office gross, which is understandable because at the end of the day money drives the world, but let's not pretend it's not white-washing. I'm not trying to start an argument so if you disagree, fine, but these excuses i've heard are pretty ridiculous.
