Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Look i understand everyone has made the argument that Motoko isn't asian, that her model is ethnically ambiguous, Japan is okay with it, that ScarJo is perfect for the role simply because she's ScarJo, or that she looks white in the anime. But hear me out plz lol

1. Argument: Motoko's supposedly isn't asian because "the creators" didn't intend for her to be a certain ethnicity and that she's ethnically ambiguous.

Rebuttal: okay just because someone is described as "ethnically ambiguous" doesn't equal white. Her name is Motoko Kusanagi or as some ppl say is her alias, but that is her name nonetheless. No one knows her past and that leaves it up to interpretation and creative freedom. SO getting an asian actress like Rinko Kikuchi (Pacific Rim) isn't far fetched. She would've been a way better casting choice in my opinion than ScarJo. This story is a very Japanese one as it deals with Japan's close association with technology and how far ur humanity goes when ur fully cybernated. also they are deliberately not straying away from the asian aesthetic. If her model is supposed to be western then how the hell is she supposed to blend in looking whiter than a snowflake?

2. Argument: Japan is okay with it.

Rebuttal: This isn't a valid argument because it's like asking how Africans feel about racism towards African-Americans in America. Their answer wouldn't have the same perspective as African-Americans. Japan, a country where there isn't much immigration and they really try not to and where they have a homogeneous society, where if a Japanese person in Japan turns on their tv what do they see? more Japanese ppl. Japanese ppl don't really understand the concept of racism or whitewashing because they never had to deal with it. we (the us) have one of the most diverse populations in the world and hollywood obviously doesn't get it. they think casting the supporting cast with different ethnic groups checks off the diversity requirement and reserving the lead role for a white actor is ideal. I mean the guy playing Ishikawa is Australian! What the hell? im sorry. we have the diversity that other parts of the world don't and its about time Hollywood started using that and representing that properly. Its also kind of sad because guess what? ppl outside the us, sees the face of America as white. so who else would they expect to fill the roles of an American Ghost in The Shell? And its sucks.

3. Argument: ScarJo is perfect because its ScarJo and she make da money.

Rebuttal: The star power myth isn't really true. nobody knew chris hemsworth before thor, nobody knew jennifer lawrence before hunger games, nobody knew Rinko Kikuchi or Charlie Hunnam before Pacific Rim, nobody knew Henry Cavill before Man of Steel or Immortals, nobody knew Aaron Taylor before Kick Ass, nobody knew any of the ppl in the Last Airbender movie (i know it was bad) but that's the point....shall I go on? Ppl are going to see the ghost in the shell simply because its ghost in the shell not because of ScarJo. And secret: "not everyone likes ScarJo".

4. Argument: She looks white in the anime.

Rebuttal: have any of u seen anime? By that argument then everyone looks white! The key is that animated characters are perceived to be how u want them to be. How do u know if the Simpsons are about a white family? they're yellow. i could make the argument that they look canadian or latino for all we know. just because they look white to u doesn't mean they are. Also if u watch Anime they deliberately makes it clear to u that someone is foreign: blonde hair, blue eyes, telling u they're mixed, and also a funny accent when speaking Japanese.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
The trailer did not capture the tone of the film. They should have reprised the opening choir of the Ghost in the Shell movie with silent background images until they talk... not some 80's nostalgia go-to. It would have been different. It would have the fans exploding. It would turn the heads of cynical reviewers.

The original content material is dark. It touches the gray area of what is and is not human. There is a reason the original's opening scene is of the main character being made from a mannequin robot. We will see how much the production company makes this controversial subject matter "safe" for public viewing.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Se nota alguna mezcla del episodio N°1 de la primer temporada, el secuestro de las cybor-geishas; Con eventos de la primer pelicula, la lucha con el basurero "hakeado" y la inteligencia artificial que busca libertad de los servicios de inteligencia yanquis.
 Los budistas en Red parece algo bien inventado para la pelicula... por lo menos yo no los recuerdo en ninguna animacion. Quizas una historia que Masaune Shirow -el creador- conto en el manga, el cual no lei.
 Se vendra la segunda entrega con el hombre sonriente? Tremenda historia !!
 Me pongo a recordar y la verdad lamento un poco haber conocido el anime japones por "ghost in the shell", ya que luego todo lo demas palicede en imnovacion, calidad, argumento o contenido -a excepcion de Evangelion, Akira y algun que otro clasico mas-.
 Si no conoces nada sobre "ghost in the shell", mirate, bajate la primera y la segunda pelicula para empezar... Tambien hay 2 temporadas de anime que son sobresalientes.
 Por suerte esta pelicula pareceria acompañar la obra animada.
 Nada de ver en internet gente! esta si que hay que ir al cine!

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Judging from this trailer, it looks faithful to the anime and is visually interesting. I just can't picture S.J. as the major, though. No, not because she's white, but for two reasons: One, Scarlett, in my opinion, is too famous. I think it would play better to bring in a relatively 'unknown' actress. All I see is Black Widow parading around as Motoko. I get it that production wants to draw in new viewers to the GIS franchise with a popular name, and I hope it works that way for them. Second, Scarlett, as fine an actress as she is, seems to me to have a perpetual 'dazed and confused' look about her, where Motoko always appears  (even in her moments of severe angst) sharp and focused.
Batou in this clip looks comedic.
I do hope the Tachikomas make an appearance, along with, maybe one of those HAW tanks. 
Bottom line is, I didn't make this movie. I just hope they keep it intelligent, tight, fun, and that it succeeds in bringing credit to the GIS franchise.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
1st, saying anime looks white is a bs reason to justify her being white. They don't look like any race. No one in real life has a triangle for a nose, eyes that huge, or natural purple/blue/green etc hair. The medium values simplicity for faces. Simply that.

I'm Asian and I think ScarJo is a great choice. Besides her being white being totally plausible within GITS' plot, here's another good reason. This movie cost a fortune to make. You need an A list actor that can make up the money used to make this movie just by her name and there are NO A-list Asian actresses. You think Hollywood is like "lets hire a white person cuz we hate minority?" NO. They arn't stupid. They know there will be backlash. Hollywood is a business. They respond to profit. If this movie succeeds =>  more anime films => more Asian themed films => more opportunity for Asian actors. You can't go from 0 to 100 just like that. I believe this is the first step in the right direction. They can't risk leaving this to any actor simply because she's Asian. 

And here's another potential and unfortunate problem if she's asian. There are tentions between Japan, and China and Korea's government and a certain degree of racism between them (This is generalizing. Not saying all everyone hates each other) .  If she's not Japanese, (especially if the actor is Chinese) that's a huge major spit in the face to Japan, the origin of Gits. It will alienate Gits "original" audiences, limiting the search pool even further. I feel like ScarJo is a pretty good buffer for now.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I believe this will be a good film though it's clear the director and crew are going for a different storyline. In the anime, the major and the rest of section 9 aren't worried about their past or trying to find out who they are or were, but rather stoping political and criminal corruption in their city. Major accepts who and what she is because she has no choice and cannot change it. It's a very nihilistic and tragic order of events that show the risks of transhumanism and turning away from our humanity to seek a high level of existence. Still, I hope this movie can set a new standard for live action anime adaptations, and that it does well. I feel more people should give it a chance.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I've heard a lot about whitewashing so I made an effort to take a look at the actual source material and honestly a lot of the main characters can be seen as Caucasian especially the major and most defiantly batou, also the place the source material is set in has a lot of people that could be seen as a mix of races not just purely Japanese,  the only difference are the names but that doesn't mean much especially for the major. also like a lot of anime the difference between races are not that easy to tell a lot of the time if you glance at anime anime most none viewers you'd blindly assume they are all Japanese because of the medium. but the truth is that due to different art styles and such the lines between races are easily muddied also Japan is no stranger to favoring their own race in adaptions. just go watch the Attack on titan live action movie. everyone in it is Japanese even though there is only actual Japanese person in the show while the majority of the cast is closer to German or a mix of nationalities.

Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Well I'm not impressed at all... creative criticisms would be the sub-par CGI, whitewashed cast (or unadapted material set in the USA, which would have made sense!), awful attempts to recreate scenes from the original movie and Batou just looks wrong! So does the Major to be honest and this whole trailer screamed ACTION FILM at me which Ghost in the Shell was never about. The original's theme was emptiness, this looks far too busy.

On a side note, I want this to be a shit film if only to deter more lazy hollywood reboots of old anime. I don't want an all American cast, action movie Akira. I don't want it, please for the love of God don't make that a thing!

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Edit2**Hodoss expertly counters my ramblings here, so make sure to read his response and my response to him further down if you actually give two flips about these comments. It's interesting to see the diversity of opinion on something like this!

Call me a "SJW" if you want, but I have a huge issue with whitewashing.  I'm a pretty race neutral kinda guy, I'm cool with anyone doing whatever and think racial "roles" are bullshit (ie music genres unbound by race, using whatever language you wish, adopting cultural customs from anywhere, etc.).  But why take an East Asian character and cast a white woman for it (who I will mention costs a pretty penny, Johannson isn't a C-Lister) when Hollywood and other film centers are filled to the brim with young Asian actors willing to do a role for cheaper to get their foot in the door in a massive way?   Why is everyone except Takeshi Kotano also whitewashed?  There's a case to be made for Bollywood adaptations not featuring actors of other races, because while India is ethnically diverse it is not so racially diverse.  Hollywood however is not Bollywood, it's a district of one of the most ethnically and racially diverse cities in one of the most diverse states in all of America.  I don't think there's malicious intent, like some cuckoos, but I think Hollywood and producers need to dig their heads out of their ass and realize there's more to film than just their usual recruiting pool.  People have argued that since the story of the Major and the film overall is a very universal one, that race does not factor into it.  That is also a perfectly reasonable argument, so don't take me as someone who's choosing a "side".

Besides that, this trailer bugs me on another level.  It's taking scenes from the 1995 film, so I assume it is a remake of the original film and maybe parts of GitS 2.0: Innocence and not Standalone Complex or Arise.  If that's the case, then why is it focusing so much on the Major's background?  1995 never really focused on where Kusanagi came from, it instead grappled with where she was going, what the new world and relationships between beings was like, even just the question of the nature of consciousness to begin with.  It was action-heavy, but it took time to focus on the internal narratives of each character or conflict in stride rather than just as a background to throw action scenes over.  The boat scene between Batou, the discovery of the Ghost,  the showdown, the epilogue conversation;  these were all narrative-crucial parts of 1995, and from this trailer I get none of that.  If the producers wanted to stay faithful to the original, why not take a more daring approach and leave us with questions?  Or hell, just pull a Full Metal Jacket trailer and distill your entire movie into a few frames and quotes?  As it stands, I know what this looks like: Robocop.  It looks like anime Robocop, and not the good one, the remake that was just meh.*

Whatever, I've spent way too much time thinking about a dumb adaptation I probably won't see unless it gets good reviews or an anime-fan friend of mine recommends.  Just my two cents.

*Looking at it closer, I think it's more likely an adaptation of the original manga, so there's more material there to be adapted.  The general point remains, however.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Reposting from a Facebook post I made, so the formatting is kinda weird, but

Since this is apparently a lose
adaptation of SAC:2nd GIG, I have no idea why they're recreating iconic scenes
from the 1995 movie. Not to mention, there isn't nearly enough screen time to
fully dedicate to the Individual Eleven, so it's strange that they're even
featuring Kuze. The decision to give focus to the Major's backstory is also an
odd one, considering that a broader understanding of the setting and the way
that it relates to the sense of self is needed to appreciate her background as
a whole. Not to mention, the notion that the Major could be the only one of
anything is incredibly strange, considering that the usual GiTS overarching
theme of questioning the self only holds up when ones body is no longer a
subject of individuality. 



It's also concerning that we don't see the rest of
Section 9. While I can understand the exclusion of Pazu, Bouma, and Seito, I'm
concerned that we don't see any of Togusa, considering how essential of a
supporting character he is for most of SAC. 



The action shots look incredibly un-GiTS like. Most
of what made the Major a strong character was her ability to lead and command
others, both during combat and out. She rarely fought alone (only twice in the
97 movie, and only around three times, give or take, in SAC), and she was never
did crazy acrobatics. While this change is understandable in the context of
Hollywood movie, more considerations should have been taken to accommodate for
the tone of GiTS.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I'm willing to give the movie a try. Honestly though, I'll be more surprised if it's actually good. Live action movies usually suck, so I'm hoping that they've at least done a decent job with this one. I'm always willing to give movies a chance--especially considering how much I love all the GitS anime, manga and guides. As far as saying most Japanese people don't care about the casting, that may or may not be true. I don't think that the opinions of few represent the opinions of many. So unless someone polls most or every single Japanese Ghost in the Shell fan in Japan, that statement is a bit hard to accept. Not saying it's right or wrong, but it really doesn't prove anything except for there are 'some' Japanese people who don't mind. Some might actually hate it, but they're less likely to complain about it since it's not anything pressing. It's just a movie. Also, Sam Yoshiba, a publisher at Kodansha, said he was fine with the Scarlett Johansson. As far as I know, the author/creator never stated that him self.

While I understand both sides of the argument, I also understand that this is an adaptation. Even the people over at Kondansha realized (and said) that since this was a Hollywood movie, they never even expected Motoko's actress to be Japanese. They never said she was or wasn't Japanese. Just that considering who was spearheading the movie, they didn't expect her to be. Take that statement as you'd like. Not saying anybody is wrong; to each their own. I'm willing to give it a try.

I love Ghost In The Shell and I did not even knows that Scarlett would be the "Major" until I see the trailer. From what I've seen so far from the film (apparently a super production) and knowing the history of the anime... I hope it is an excellent movie, I will watch with the open mind, even because if it gets bad, I will watch the anime again and life goes on... 

Now, what piss me off is that... Think about the money invested, commitment and work that everyone had to do to this movie come true and arrive to you... And after that, come some people to denigrate this without watch it... But the  life is this, the people are prejudiced (any opinion or feeling conceived without critical examination)...

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I wonder how similar this will be to the previous GitS canon. In the manga/anime, Kusanagi was more or less pulverised in an accident as a child, and she became a full body cyborg afterwards. She learned to control her cybernetics while her brain was still young and flexible, and the reason she is badass was not because "[she] is the first of [her] kind!", but more that she is a prodigious mind naturally at home in a military grade full body prosthesis. In the first episode of Stand Alone Complex, the plot revolved around someone masquerading as a Geisha-sexbot, putting their own brain inside the full body prosthesis of a prominent Japanese politician. When she herself was "cyberized", a fellow survivor of the plain crash agreed to the same a couple of days after she visited him in her new body. I hope they don't butcher Kusanagi's character by making her awesome because she is some "chosen one", instead of a driven and intelligent woman pursuing a career in law enforcement.

Comment: I hope they don't make it too much about the Major's past. Her previous life before becoming augmented wasn't ever the point of the plot, that was just part of her character while the series was meant to be about the mysterious territory of cyberization and the blurred lines between cyborgs, androids, and advanced AIs. This better not just be "You took my life away" crap and then the Major just killing those she was crossed by.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: As someone who has never seen the anime, read the manga, and has only seen one of the anime movies, this looks pretty good. However... this IS a live action anime adaptation we're talking about here. They have so many opportunities to disappoint the fans and I'm sure they're going to find a way to do them all. Hopefully I'm wrong and we'll finally get the first GOOD live action anime adaptation... at least when it comes to an American film crew since there have been good anime live action films... just... all of them have been made in Japan. Maybe other film makers will be able to take notes and figure out how to make a good film. Maybe we'll be able to get a good Dragon Ball film instead of the train wreck that came out years ago. Maybe there'd be a possibility for the Death Note film to be decent.

Japan is predominantly Japanese. And yes Japanese people are ok with this but why not cast Japanese people? I'm just curious, yes America is mostly white people but who is the movie catering to?  Are they trying to say that "white America" would only be interested in the movie cause there are white people in it.. in Japan.. or are they saying in the future white people take over japan... or perhaps they don't understand their audience like most producers who make pre-researched judgements, cause their audience really likes a Japanese things..*anime*cough*.. probably that last one. Just saying...

Also, I can't wait to see the movie. It seems like everyone working on the movie did their job fantastically except for casting... I'm still not talking about Scarlett, cause she will alone pull the non-anime fans to watch the movie... they didn't need to change everyone else...or the extras...

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
It's a sad attempt by the so called "fans" who are not familiar with the Major's background to always bring up race when in the manga and anime her ethnicity was never disclosed. She can manifest herself into anything since she is an artificial intelligence with an artificial body but implanted with a human brain. "Artificial body" should give you a hint that she can look European, Japanese, African, or whatever ethnicity she chooses since she is now an artificial intelligence. In the anime she experiences plenty of near death scenarios to a point where her body is almost completely destroyed. She is brought back to life by her organization by fixing her all over again therefore, she can look different if her organization wishes by giving her another artificial body. 

Masamune Shirow, the original author of the manga, indicated that the concept of GitS is global, meaning it is a story blended with Western and Japanese themes. The story was based on humanity's increasing reliance on the internet and technology, which is prevalent today. The advent of the internet in America, specifically Google, influenced the story and Masamune also researched studies from Japanese universities about technology's impact throughout the world therefore, the story is about humanity losing a sense of identity due to our reliance and obsession with technology.

Plus, I find it ironic when people say race when we are all human. What they mean is ethnicity. Either way, the Major has a dilemma about her identity, whether she is purely ai or human. In the anime she said she does not know if her memories are hers or from someone else since her brain was implanted. 

However, she has grown so accustomed to her life as a cyborg agent owned by the Japanese government. Her body was manufactured by her organization so she is an important asset to them therefore, she lost her identity as a human when she had to undergo critical cybernetic enhancement as a very young child around the age of six.

Before anyone brings up her name being Motoko Kusanagi, well that does not automatically qualify her as being Japanese. My name is Christian Gonzales. People automatically assume that I am Hispanic when I am actually Filipino. I may be Filipino but I identify myself as American because I have never been nor grew up in the Philippines, so I don't know anything about their culture but America's. I have plenty of Korean friends who have names that don't sound like the culture of their ethnicity like Daniel Johnson or Michael Trenton. People come from all over the world so I would not be surprised to see an African or a European  with a Japanese name in Japan if they have breathe and lived the culture ever since they were born there.

Point is, the Major's ethnicity was never disclosed in the anime or manga but her race certainly was and that is maybe human (her human implanted brain) or maybe artificial intelligence. Also, there was the fact that as a child she had to undergo major cybernetic enhancement in order to live due to a life threatening accident. 

The story is about her trying to find out her identity ever since she changed into an advanced cyborg.

Before you call me a bigot for supporting the whitewashing in the Hollywood film industry, of which there is, I don't see that applying in this setting. It is appropriate for someone like ScarJo to be casted in this story because she really pulls off the character of Major well. I am impressed by her performance so far, but I will reserve judgement about the film until it releases. 

To reiterate, the Major is a character with a lost identity with a past of a human as a child but a current life of an artificial intelligence. She has a dual race as a  human and ai but an unknown ethnicity, and the story is not exclusively a Japanese concept but blended with Western and global influence.﻿

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Well, overall, the trailer gets me pretty hyped but I'm left thinking about how the Tone of the world is a bit... overwhelming. Comparing it to the anime where tranquility amidst chaos reigned rampant, this provides me with a sense of realism being forced, what do you guys think? I feel the ultimate disappointment when it came to the remaining team being cast/ how they look compared to the original. Maybe what's actually going to spoil it for me is going to be all the scenes where I remember how different the tone, the atmosphere that the world was seeming drowning in, the visual representation of something so unadaptable. We may just see "The Watchmen" yet again, another movie where the un-adaptable is being adapted.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: And this is where I lose faith in humanity when we allow America to do Japan's job. The trailer felt completely off from what I've seen in the actual anime series; the actress looks right but feels like a try-hard. The other main actors don't fit the bill in appearance, and their voices are off too. The anime Ghost in the Shell was deep and dark, and while the graphics for the scenery are amazing, I'm already getting the impression this movie is going to be lackluster. Japan, do your job, make this great, so all of us fans can give you our money and go home happy. Please for the love of God.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: They borrowed a lot of imagery from the first movie and the TV show, I can recognize scenes. What's making me sweat is the generic "She lost her memory!" plot, which was never in any aspect of the anime, movies, or comics, and has always been cliche and boring as all hell. I was digging it up until then, then got cold chills because it started to remind me of the Resident Evil shit. Hopefully they don't make this suck. If nothing else, maybe it'll be a good cyberpunk film.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
A) Is this PG13? :| They're clearly going for recreating some iconic scenes from the original, but with a PG13 it won't work!
B) The Major is practical, first and foremost. In the original if she's not planning on using her cloak then she's wearing regular body armour (cloak underneath). In the trailer at 0:25 she's assaulting some...place without armour and without her cloak? Why?
C) Is this going to be a "let's recreate the iconic scenes, add nothing new, slay the story" type of deal? It smells like it...

Now, don't get me wrong - I'd love for this thing to work. But the trailer doesn't fill me with confidence.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I really like some parts of this trailer, specially the fact that they mostly respected the anime aesthetics. But the music was a great disappointment. The OST by Kenji Kawai was so perfect that I feel it is almost irreplaceable. The anime's intro song just set the tone for the whole movie in such a special way, it gives me chills everytime I hear it. I really hope that they consider using songs like the anime's OST and not only cyberpunk remixed versions of 80's/early 90's hits... The idea may sound cool at first, but it just don't fit GitS style in my opinion.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I'm very happy that production studios believe in Ghost in the Shell and casted the most successful and awesome actress ever! I'm also glad that Scarlett was interested in the story. It's a Hollywood production and therefore an American adaption, but I believe it isn't simply about whitewashing but about giving the movie a strong character that is proven to attract audience.

Also, this will make the movie much more high profile and attract mainstream audience instead of comic fans only. Great chance to show how complex and well written manga can be.

Don't forget that if you want to see more Asian actors in movies support movies that feature Asian actors! Numbers is what studios understand. 

Have a good day.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: it's a pity they didn't use an asian actress for the main role, but it's understandable? I mean, remember Pacific Rim? Yeah, the female lead was asian and the movie was very much inspired by mecha animes, and most people though the movie sucked for those sole reasons. Imagine if Ghost in the Shell had an asian lead, *so many people* wouldn't watch just because of that. So my hope is that by having a white lead, although it is sad, at least it makes people watch and enjoy, and then maybe watch the anime and realize it's still a good story even without a white protagonist. It's my hope that we can make people watch movies with asian characters and not assume it is bad.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: This looks absolutely horrible.  There were at least a dozen shots that were straight recreations of scenes from the original groundbreaking anime and GITS 2 Innocence.  Reminds me of Terminator Genisys essentially reshooting scenes from the original classic verbatim.  And her thermoptic camouflage is worse; not just the suit but her visor looks like something a Cub Scout made.  "This is Major"?? I just threw up in my mouth a little.  I'm a huge sci-fi nut, but this just looks bad, bad, bad.  Will see when it hits Blu-ray, not before.  Voting with my dollars on this one.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Mmm... Not sold yet... The original movie was amazing and I'll definitely give this a chance, but so far it just looks like all the other cheap remakes... We'll see I guess...
Also, what's up with the Major being the "first of her kind"? They're pretty much _all_ cyborgs to some extend (or at least a lot of them) or am I horribly misremembering this? Feels like they were trying to give her a little added backstory but what they really did was butcher the setting. The whole question of identity thing works a lot better if the technology is ubiquitous and a part of everyday life for (nearly) everyone. If the main character is just "oh so special" again it kinda makes it more bland... I don't know... I'm not feeling it and it has nothing to do with the casting...

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: This is a show that had an episode where AI tanks were discussing and exploring their own consciousness, even mentioning Richard Dawkins; no reductionism necessary. There were enough elements in GITS to "cool-ify" for the commercial audiences and they could have layered it to maintain some sort of lifeline with the people who liked the philosophical exploration. No, it's not cool to change the story like this. The point of GITS is to explore what it means to be human in an increasingly fuzzy AI world, terrorism, war etc, from a multitude of perspectives. It never needed cheap cliches and there was intellectual respect for the audiences. Motoko Kusanagi is supposed be La  Femme Nikita's Madeleine level of greatness. Her exact LACK of identity crisis, capacity for emotional adjustment, strategic prowess, leadership and political skills ,used to be the most lovable things about her. Major is not reactionary and needy. I'm hoping it's just a bad trailer.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
The problem with this movie, or the casting is, that the source material is not really mainstream to begin with. I'm well aware, that the 1995 movie was successful and popular in it's own demographic area, but not outside of it. Now even if the manga/anime was popular outside it's mainstream genre, it still would need a marketable star to be bring in the profits that it is aiming for. And can someone name one Asian actress, or in particular a Japanese actress, that is popular and and fit enough to make this movie a blockbuster hit?
In my honest opinion, it the character is portrayed in a dignified and tasteful manner, I don't care what ethnic background he or she has.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I was one of those GITS fans that would of preferred a Japanese actress to play Major Kusanagi because it is a Japanese character, but sometimes you have to put yourself in the shoes of the directors and producers who have to choose an actress who can both act and look the part and attract an audience rather than just someone who may just look the part. GITS is not a franchise that is very well known to the whole world, so they have to sell it to everyone, not just to GITS fans.  You can also take a look at Jpanaese anime itself and notice that the characters, as in most anime don't actually look Japanese or Asian. They look western. So Scarlett Johansson actually does look the part more than a Japanese actress would.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
으하하하하하.
이렇게 진지한 사이버 펑크 작품의 예고편으로 보면서 크게 웃었던 적은 처음입니다.
01:13 B급 영화의 그래픽입니까? 그리고 이어지는 01:28 바트의 동그랑땡 안구는 정말이지 충격과 공포군요.
파라마운틴, 드림웍스는 작품이 이렇게 엇나가는동안 아무 제재를 안했다는게 놀랍습니다.
그냥 새로운 이야기로 진행하지 왜 1995년 극장판과, TV판의 이야기를 넣어어서 원작을 욕보이는거죠. 어설프게 원작의 장면들을 집어넣고 마코토 소령은 스칼렛 요한슨으로  어색함의 극치를 찍었네요. 기계적이면서 차가운 카리스마는 던져버리고 헐벗은체 뛰어놓는 스트립 걸로 만들어놨습니다. 몸뚱이도 찰흙으로 빗어놓은 것처럼 만들어놓고, 12세 관람가로 만들고 싶었나? 그냥 성인용으로 만들지. 원작팬 + 스칼렛 요한슨 고용으로 마블팬 + 저연령층의 관객으로 돈을 벌고 싶었나봅니다.
음악은 기대를 안했지만 역시나 원작의 사이버 펑크 느낌은 전무하고, 그렇다고 신선한 사이버 펑크의 느낌도 전혀 없이 그저그런 헐리우드 음악을 만들었군요. 컨셉 아트에는 온통 와패니즘에 전혀 공감되지 않는 사이버 펑크(저걸 사이버 펑크라고 표현할 수 있다면) 요소들만 허무하게 채워져 있습니다.
원작의 팬이라면 적든 크든 실망할 수 밖에 없는 작품입니다. 원작의 리메이크는 아니지만 공각 기동대의 영화화는 매트릭스가 훌륭히 해냈죠. 아, 눈 씻고 와야겠습니다. 개봉후 본편을 보고 더 대차게 까야할지 예고편을 본 기억을 지워 버려야 할지 고민입니다.
예고편을 보러 오신분들 중에 원작을 보지 않으신 분이 계시다면 꼭 원작을 보시길 바랍니다. 원작 팬들이 왜 예고편만 보고 혹평을 하는지 아실 수 있어요.

아, 생각할 수록 빡치네. 제목 바꿔라. 원작 모욕하지마.

Comment: For those talking about the race of the main character here, ALL countries do it based on the percentage of the predominant race in that country. I live in Japan, and 99 percent of all actors cast here are JAPANESE. Why? Because the country is 99 percent Japanese. If you want an official breakdown of races in America:  Non-Hispanic whites: 63 percent of the U.S.; Hispanics, 17 percent; blacks, 12.3 percent; Asians. IF you want a movie with mostly Asian casting, make a movie in an Asian country. Profit mathematics are going to dictate this, not anything else. The Japanese producers who gave the rights to Hollywood to make the movie expected as such, and have praised the choice of Scarlet as being perfect for the role.

Comment:
This is getting ridiculous, and I don't care if I wrote riculous wrong : "popular" movies are getting in four categories
 
 1. Flat out blushit with no cinematic interest whatsoever (Hello there Marvel-money-machine)

 2. Straight-up comedic idiocy promulgating some terrible message to the masses  (Hello War Dogs or whatever Hangover Middle-East Edition is called)

 3. Re-hash, or the art of telling the same kind of stories over and over again in the same way (Hello Spotlight, Trumbo and all the "Based on a true story" bullshit)

 4. And this kind of movie who thinks that because you put some aesthetics on a seen and re-seen "philosophical" message you get a Classic 

Don't believe me? Well, just check the success movies (the ones that make milions and so) that have come out since January, except some RARE exceptions (like Hateful Eight or Hail Ceasar), every single one of them get in at least one of those categories.

Cinema needs a change, because the box-office money machine is killing it

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
OK, I'm sold on Johanson then. Not yet sold on Batau, and the skin-suit fight scenes look like they need a lot of cleanup work, ... and that slow-mo water thing near the intro still reeks of Airbender.

But one of the more worrying bits is this "search for my past" BS that was never an aspect of the original story. I won't say we have to perfectly mirror the original story, or that "search for my past" would be impossible to pull off, but it won't be easy. My spidey senses just detect a lot of "hitchiker's guide, the film" hollywood romantic and/or pandering BS cluttering up the story. ;P

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I don't give a crap about "whitewashing", the character specifically states in SAC that she uses off the shelf bodies to make her less conspicuous, plus she keeps smashing them up so it makes sense for her to use a relatively cheap model.

What I do care about is the dumbing down of the philosophical aspect of the movie, which looks as though they've taken all the high concept thought provoking exploration of the nature of the self and what it means to be a human and reduced it down to "One woman's struggle to rediscover her past".

Dull american psycho-babble, self-help, Opera Winffrey, teen-angst melodrama.

Nice work people.

Still if it can do anything to introduce new audiances to the original Movie, the SAC and the Manga then it's not a bad thing, but for me this will never be "Ghost in The Shell"

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: JohanssonOk, one minute was enough for me. Sorry, but I'm not buying any of this one the same level as I did the anime (Which I enjoy BTW) something about it comes off feeling strange in a "Fakey Movie effects" sort of way. It's missing something, and I don't quite know what that is. But you can feel the difference right away, and not in a good way. I'll get things thrown at me, but I don't like Scarlett Johansson in this role, or situation either. Overall, I think it's a fine application of the rule everyone seems to have forgotten: Never do in Live-Action what you can do in Animation, and never do in Animation what you can do in Live-Action. Sorry, but I think this one has "Turkey" written all over it, and not just because  it's mid-November.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
PLEASE enough about the Asian actress thing. 😑 If you know the original movie, you know Major Kusanagi is drawn with a caucasian appearance, as are MANY main anime characters.  So much anime that is worth remembering has main characters drawn as 'white'.  The artists were Asian and that was their decision with their art.  Please, if you don't know classic Anime then you really shouldn't complain.  Go watch the original 1995 Ghost in the Shell PLEASE.. also Akira, Ninja Scroll, Patlabor, Vampire Hunter D, etc... get educated. ✓
My biggest problem with this movie is the casting.  Scarlett is amazing in her own way but she's no Major.......  This movie doesn't need Scarlett.  It needs a physically perfect, somewhat absent faced SOLDIER.  The reason I watch the original again and again is because the Major kicks so much ass.  It's not her words that make me a fan.  It's her physicality.  Her strength.  Her top of the line BANGIN' Cyborg Body.  How Naive she is...  Scarlett is sultry.  We need a new face with the physicality of Adriana Lima combined with a top olympic athlete.  Such a huge disappointment from a huge fan like me.  😔😔😔
The other thing that scares me is the fact that some scenes in this trailer look almost IDENTICAL to scenes from the original Anime.  If you've seen the real life adaptation of "Blood, The Last Vampire" then you'll share with me in my fear of this being a let down...  Trying to replicate the exact Anime in a real life setting is kinda like eating reheated nachos.  It sucks.  Make new story lines and other kick ass settings.  That way we'll have nothing to compare it to.  I hope it's good.  I really do....  But if it sucks, as a huge fan of GITS....  I'll be pissed.  🍀

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: When will these people get it... anime/manga does not transition well into live action. The genre's unique style and approach to storytelling is what brings the masses. I honestly don't understand why producers are suddenly trying to grab big titles like this one and "Hollywood-ify" them. I can see this movie being a hit for anyone who has never delved into the original anime and/or manga series, but that GITS feeling will be missing for the more diehard fan base. You just can't get the proper atmosphere from live action adaptations.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I've seen the anime, but not the manga - because translating them to finnish is expensive and not many publishers do it. This trailer shows that something always changes from one format to the other. Thankfully the question of identity embedded in technology seems to be there. Slow-mo action is getting a bit overused, perhaps it's just the trailer?
I don't like the choice of music - Pet Shop Boys is too familiar and a dull choice, overrated 90's disco garbage. Changing the tempo is just life support to an un-imaginative song. Anime had much more interesting music.

Comment:
Visually it looks good, but the Major looks and sounds too vulnerable.

I sceptical an origin story was a good move, because this trailer felt like a Jason Bourne
 movie. The anime did focus on broad social and philosophical implications of power, freedom and individuality in a world of machine-human hybridisation, but the Major is usually a reticent, disciplined and mysterious character, whose emotional attachments are only hinted at.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
An honest review of this trailer against loving the anime: Johansson playing Motoko is just fine, if you are going to get anal about someone "white" playing someone who has a japanese name then go live in Japan. Seriously.
Batou is too short and not muscular enough.
They take the focus off of "what is the soul" and focus more on what Motoko is vs the general populace.
Taking scenes from the 1995 film is nice, but loses its impact if you don't take every scene. Take all or take none.
The "love" story between Batou and Motoko shouldn't kick in for a long while.
Motoko doesn't start questioning her past for a while.
Don't try to cram 2 seasons and 3 movies into one film.
Still going to watch it though...

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
This anime movie is so much deeper then this. These films will always look visually stunning but these "adaptations" constantly ruin the originals. The main source of these films/graphic novels, are filled with rich context and themes that make you wonder. What made Ghost in the shell so powerful along with other animes/graphic novels is the existential questions that are placed throughout the story. There are strong themes of identity in the original ghost in the shell, questions like  "what is consciousness?" This theme centers around the character and her not feeling that she needs to find out "who or what she is" but rather "what is" 

This film feels like a dumbed down version of reinterpreted version of the original.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
For those who are interested in watching the anime version, this is my recommendation of the chronological order to watch it in. 


(Movie Universe)
Ghost in the Shell (1995)
Ghost in the Shell 2: Innocence [Though it's a direct sequel it seems like another universe]

(Stand Alone Complex Universe)
Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex
Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex 2nd GIG
Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex - Solid State Society


(Arise Universe)
Ghost in the Shell: Arise - Border:1 Ghost Pain
Ghost in the Shell: Arise - Border:2 Ghost Whispers
Ghost in the Shell: Arise - Border:3 Ghost Tears
Ghost in the Shell: Arise - Border:4 Ghost Stands Alone
Ghost in the Shell (2015)

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
This trailer doesn't alleviate my concerns. It feels like she's just playing Lucy again (which feels overly dramatic and awkward). This feels like it's about to be an expensive shallow cash grab, especially with that awful overly dramatic rendition of "Enjoy The Silence". It feels like it's trying to be Sucker Punch instead of Blade Runner. It'll sell tickets, sure, but will it make a profit? Will people buy the DVD and talk about it long after it's out of theaters or will it be just another expensive throwaway blockbuster?

And casting anyone other than Ron Perlman as Batou still feels like a mistake (but that's not being fair to Pilou Asbæk since I've never seen any of his work).

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
This is going to suck. Scarlett Johansson just isn't a good choice for Major Kusanagi. For one, she emotes way more than the Major should. The Major is stoic 90% of the time, so when she does show the slightest bit of emotion, it's powerful. This performance doesn't capture that stoicism.

Plus, most of the scenes in this trailer are unoriginal. They just remade a lot of iconic scenes from the various animated movies and shows in live action. That doesn't give me much hope for the plot.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
To everyone complaining. Here is my retort. Please name a major Japanese Hollywood actress who could appropriately replace Scarlett in this movie. I am not asking for any Japanese actress, I am looking for one who works in America with Hollywood and is recognizable enough that they would sell the types of tickets that Scarlett can (and often does). 

Don't be mad at Hollywood for going with the best people who will make them money, it's why only a handful of actors get the best roles every year. Look at how many roles Will Smith or Denzel get and compare that/how much money they make to other black actors. Hollywood goes for money. It's why they keep pumping out Fast & Furious movies; people keep going to see them

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Seems like they're doing a good job in a lot of aspects, but I'm not sure what the focus on the Major is about.  I'm not GitS expert, but her past didn't seem like that was a huge part in any of the anime, and her body was just military-grade.

Many of these scenes are taken straight from the first movie, which is cool, but it'll be interesting to see who the antagonist is with how they're setting it up.  Despite the changes, it seems to respect the theme of the series more than most other anime-based movies.  Hopefully it'll be good.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I'm a little bit worried... the Ghost in the Shell anime movie was known to "not" use any movie cliche'. remember the helicopter scene on the anime movie? when she disembark on the heli she was able to sense a cloaked tank was near by so she immediately ask the helicopter pilots to evade and go back to base. All of her crew survived and only her shell was the casualty. Above all she always have a "commanding aura" when she speaks, people follows and for her the survival of her crew is of high priority. In the trailer it might be an origins story... like a mix from the movie anime storyline and her origins storyline... it could be that this time she actually is the target of the puppet master. I just hope and wish that it does not use movie cliche'...

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie

Its like the Wachowski brothers were brought on as consultants. Like GITS got smashed up with Cloud Atlas. At least in Cloud Atlas they yellow faced the future. Will not be watching this in theatres. -_-

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I really don't think that asking for a Japanese actress, to play a Japanese character, in a Japanese story, that takes place in Japan is being "too PC."

Motoko Kusanagi's background was never specified, and she's a cyborg, so yes, she can be anybody. 

This is Hollywood, and they want to market the movie to the West, so they are going to hire someone like Scarlett Johansson, who is pretty damn good for the role. Finances come first, before any accurate representation, sadly. 

And yes, it goes both ways. I know Japan made a movie on AOT with asians, instead of Europeans, and Idris Elba played Heimdall.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
The focus seems more on the "intrigue"' where Major come from, what the bad guys know she doesnt about the corporation that made her, etc. The original was more about the soul in a world of machine, the connexion between being, than about the "intrigue" itself. It was more a japanese theme, now we are more into typical Hollywood intrigue. Plus, Major was had a ambiguous ethnic look somewhere between Asian and Occidental, but Scarlett is 100% American looking. And Major was androgynous (except for the big boobs), she had strong muscular features in the anime (androgyneity is another strong theme in japanese animations along with occidental/oriental ambiguity), here she is the embodiement of american white feminity (i love Scarlett, but not the right casting)

Honestly, i am afraid Hollywood will lost the "Ghost" of this story, it soul, in favor to something more watchable for American public. But its hard to say for sure with a 2 minutes trailer. It could be that they focused on these aspects in the trailer to attract peoples and the film itself will have less white washing and will stay closer to the original spirit than this preview seem to let us know.  

In short, the preview show a superficial recreation of the "shell" of the original with cute looking exotic imagery, but not of the "ghost"

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I'm a huge fan of the Masamune Shirow manga, Production IG anime and before all of the Mamoru Oshii movies (I love also the GITS videogames, especially the one on the PS1), but when I first here that hollywood was making a movie about it I imagined it would be terrible.
And from this trailer it looks worse than what I espected.
The last thing that bothered me is the casting choice of Scarlette Johanson, I thing she is a good actrees.
What I don't like is the shitty cgi, the fact that they mixed scene copied 1-to-1 as they were in the anime (why a movie has to looks like an anime?) with the usual stuff from hollywood blockbusters (lesbo kiss? Are you serius?).
From the trailer seems also that they have decide to give a different backstory to the Major Motoko Kusanagi, and it is in my opinion one of the most stupid choice that they could have done.
I will pass it.

Comment:
To answer the two most common question people ask:
1.) Yes, this is an adaption from an anime.
2.) Don't worry on weather or not you saw the original, movie adaptions explain the story from beginning to end. For example, "The Shining" is a movie adaptation from author Steven King, but we all still understand the plot when we watch it even if we didn't read the book. Other classic examples include Fight Club, American Psycho, Silence of the Lambs, Trainspotting,  Apocalypse Now, and The Godfather.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Erg... Ummm... Eh? 
That's not what Ghost in the Shell is really about, it's about being a slave to your employer, loss of identity in a technological world, the nature of sentience. The Major never really cared that much about her past and definitely WASNT the first full cyborg. She WAS the first AI-human hybrid born of merging with the AI from Section 9.

This could divide fans. 

I am hesitant and pessimistic... Though not completely as it is beautiful, very close to the source material.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Okay, setting aside the divisive issue of the casting for a moment, and just focusing on the content...

...What the hell is this? This plays like somebody watched the Mamoru Oshii film once, remembered all the cool action scenes, and completely ignored the strong characterization and intricate storytelling that makes the franchise as a whole so popular.

I don't know why they would give such a boring and generic character arc to a character as potentially interesting as the Major. I don't know what the hell Aramaki is doing standing over somebody with a revolver like some Yakuza hitman. I don't know where the Fuchikoma (or Tachikoma) are. I don't know how Michael Pitt's dialogue at the end is supposed to resemble anything the Laughing Man would ever say. And the actor delivering Batou's lines just sounds bored.

Artistic license is important, and telling new stories is important. But when you can replace the _Ghost in the Shell_ logo with an original title and just market this as an original film, that's a sign that you fucked up. Taking all of the recognizable names and a couple of set-pieces from an existing property and throwing everything else away is not the way to make a good adaptation.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
One thing I really liked about the original was that it dealt with very philosophical issues. For example, there was a part where the villain (a very advanced AI) demanded asylum because it was a sentient entity. Somebody barked "You're not! You're just a self preserving program!". To which it replied "By that rationale, I submit that your DNA is nothing more than a self-preserving program". That made me go "Oh wow, it has a point!". It actually made me think whether we are, in essence, just a very advanced computer program, which is a disturbing thought because I've always thought of computer programs as being very "limited", whereas I envision us humans as being superior because we have choice and free will to do what we want. But what if that's not the case, and what if the AI is right? That we're just like a computer program, and we don't really have choice or free will, that we're limited by our DNA just like the AI is limited by its programming?
And if the AI is right, then how long before we create an AI that's so advanced that it would become morally unacceptable to simply shut it off because it's just too aware of itself?
I think that was the unique thing about the movie, that it actually made me think. Whereas I can just turn my brain off and enjoy most movies, this one actually made me stop and ponder about, you know, life in general.
I'm not getting that vibe from this movie as of yet. It just feels like a movie where the character has a personal quest, which has been done over and over again in one way or the other.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Idris Alba was cast as Heimdall in Thor. Michael B. Jordan was cast as Johnny Storm. Samuel Jackson was cast as Nick Fury. Lucy Liu was cast as Alex Munday in Charlies Angel's. Shawn and Marlon Wayans played white women in White Chicks.

These are all instances of actors being cast in roles of white characters, or in the case of the last example, portraying the reversal of the controversial "black face". There are many more examples to draw from. If you look at any of the other film industries around the world, they mostly cast actors of their respective nationalities. There are more examples of "white roles" being portrayed by other nationalities than any others. Trying to create a race based narrative for casting decisions is actually perpetuating the divide, so I say, stop being racist, and encouraging the exclusion of an entire race from a role. Perhaps they simply cast the best person for the role.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Well, i have a different view on all of this. Throughout the entire series emphasis is not on physical but on "mind state" of the characters. It's about philosophy, moral, our place in the universe, even religion... It is ment to be universal, not dependent of race, nation, sex or any goddamn stupid thing we waste our time on. It is exalted in a way that we, the humanity, have evolved into higher state of conscience and no longer care about such petty things like race (though new problems arose). That is why i like this series (aside the obvious reasons), it make me think that we are capable of higher things. And then i see animals fighting over race and physical appearance. Just who even cares, that is not the point, it need to ambiguous so why not deviate a little? Also just cause u watch anime does not mean u are authority on Japan culture.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Let's ignore the SJW tantrum and get to the point.  From what can be seen here, Hollywood is going to screw up a great franchise.  

Instead of a smart bad-ass battle hardened soldier and god level hacker who knows who she is, where she came from, where she's going, and who's ass she'll kick when she gets there, this film features a glum amnesiac.  

Instead of a nebulous mystery like the puppet master, swarming threat like the stand alone complex, a calculating opponent like Goda, or an untouchable menace like the Laughing Man, this film has a bot which lost its old data files.  

Instead of a subtext discoursing on the ontology and epistemology in a context where real and virtual merge to become inseparable, this film has angst.  

This trailer has the films best parts, and there aren't any.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I consider myself a huge fan of Shirow's GITS, read the manga, watched both seasons of the TV series and of course the 1995 Movie as well as a sequel called Innosence. And being that guy who has all of that behind his shoulders is like being the worst critic for this upcoming adaptation, especially considering the fact that the story needed no adaptatio sincen the 1995 movie in itself is a fricking masterpiece that'll blow you away. I've said to myself that I should try to put off the scepticism till I see it of course because I still kind of had hopes for the adaptation...Buuut that was back when we only had those small teasers, when I saw this trailer I kind of figured out what this actually will be  - a Hollywood action flick with a bland plot that just took some cool concepts from the original story. So this is about some type of conspiracy behind Motoko's past? "They stole it" Really? Yet another "i-don't-know-my-past-those -bastards-took-it-from-me-for-whatever-evil-reason-jason-bourne" type thing just with Geishas and Lesbians and an occasional Takeshi instead of CIA guys? Come on!!!! Who plays Bato? The guy from Need For Speed, the guy who played a King in a WarCraft Movie? Couldn't they've tried harder to find someone who is at least as big as he should've been? Not to mention the totally different face. I mean COME THE F ON!!! Who is the guy at the end of the trailer? The Puppet Master?????? NOOO!!! Not like this please. I'm sure this will be a spit in the face of those who loves GITS like I do and for those unfamiliar with the franchise it will establish a wrongful opinion that GITS is some cyborg action flick with a generic plot. Don't get me wrong I want this to be good with all my heart, but something tells me it's just isn't going to be...

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I'm alright with Scarlett being cast as Mak-, I mean, The Major. She has the character's looks and the sex appeal to sell the movie in the US. Batou's ethnicity has always been somewhat ambiguous, yet they lazily cast a white guy who doesn't really look the part. He has Batou's physique while shirtless, but just looks overweight with a coat on. Aramaki is supposed to be short, skinny, and non-combative, yet he waves a revolver around like Togusa, who's nowhere to be seen.

It's unsurprising that they took liberties with the fact that people in this world can switch into whatever bodies they want. But when you meld characters with distinctively different personalities like Aramaki and Togusa into something unrecognizable, this movie seems more like a money-grabber than a love letter to fans.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I honestly can't tell if this will be bad or not, which I guess is a good thing.  These western adaptations of eastern anime never work out, but you gotta at least appreciate the effort on display here.  I think this movie has a little too much of that "summer blockbuster" feel to it when Ghost in the Shell is supposed to be a deliberate and intelligent story peppered with the occasional grand action scene.  Anyway, it remains to be seen, but I hope this is good.  It looks like it could be.

P.S. I'm not sure if Scarlett Johansson was right for this role.  The Major is supposed to be a very confident and strong person, but Scarlett gives off a stoic and soft demeanor.  Watching the anime, The Major is like the most capable and intelligent operator in Section 9, and instantly gives off a lasting impression being such a well-rounded female lead character.  I fear that aspect of her character is lost in this casting, which is a shame, because Motoko (The Major) is one of the most endearing female characters in anime.

Comment:
Honestly, I think people would've been sold on this movie from the visuals alone. Celebrity is overrated. Remember how producers kept thinking Chloe Grace Moretz could carry a movie? What makes her any more deserving than an unknown Asian actress? Why not do the Star Wars approach and fill the supporting cast with celebrities and keep the leads unknown?

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: this plot looks... sort of not so much like a ghost in the shell story. The major was never hyper concerned with the cliche things like 'Where did I come from?' or 'People are apart from me, because I'm synthetic' nor did she ever say dumb things like "Maybe next time you can design me better". She has a real sense of humor about herself and the rest of her team,  she was NOT a broody Mary Sue. GitS isn't about Major Kusanagi it's about the society of future japan, and where things go from black and white to grey, and making her the entire focus of the movie doesn't make any sense. Even the title of the show, Ghost in the Shell, is a commentary on humanity and synthetics.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I like how all of these people criticizing Scarlett Johansson as The Major simply don't understand how movies work. 

Hollywood movies are all about making money. It's a business. If you make a movie based off of an anime film which isn't very well known in the U.S., use Japanese actors and actresses who aren't very well known, and expect the movie to make money, you're going to have a bad time.

Ghost in the Shell isn't Star Wars. You can't throw in actors that no one knows and get people to see it based off of the name alone. So, the only other thing you can do to get people to take notice of the film is to hire an A-list actress to take on the main role. Scarlett Johansson is the reason people who don't know what Ghost in the Shell is will see this movie. She's proven she can take on badass female leads, which The Major definitely is. 

Besides, what makes The Major Japanese, aside from her name (Motoko Kusanagi)? She's a cyborg. She could have looked like anyone, of any ethnicity. In the original movie, she doesn't even look particularly Japanese. And her ethnicity, realistically, is irrelevant to the plot of the original movie. The movie could have taken place in any major city of the world, as long as the themes of identity and human interaction with technology were still present.

So, to everyone claiming whitewashing and all that bullshit, do some research into how Hollywood operates and stop spouting your idiocy. If there was an A-list Japanese actress who was ignored for Johansson, then you would have a point, but that's simply not the case.

It might work after all Ghost in Shell often worked pest with heavy questions and it seems this movie might have them. I hold on to a bit of hope

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
although this looks alright and scarjo lookin spicy as always it mildly bugs me that it looks like the Japanese aspects which are a central component to the overarching themes of the GITS stories looks just to be being used here as an exotic backdrop, with all characters of real consequence just being white people. That's not inherently a bad thing; you can write a fun buddy-cop cyberpunk story of a bunch of white dudes fighting evil and shit in a vaguely oriental-looking setting, that's fine. But it ain't GITS. 

That being said this is just a trailer. Could be wrong. At least beat takeshi in it, guess i can't complain.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
For the record, the 1995 Ghost in the Shell movie opens with this statement:
"In the not so distant future, when the corporate networks fill the Earth with electronic and optical communication lines, but society has not yet been too computerized to erase nations and races..."

Anyone who says the characters' races don't matter cause their cyborgs wasn't paying attention to all the political subtext and commentary in SAC series. 

Finally they are episodes in ghost in the shell where they meet  Caucasian  Americans and they look different from Motoko.  This proves at the VERY LEAST she isn't Caucasian.

"But but, scarlett johansson is a box office success thats why she was casted"

WRONG, the producers wanted Margot Robbie but she was filming tarzan and was booked with suicide squad. 

"She wasn't white in the anime"

Actually she was, and in Arise you can very briefly see her parents. 

"WHAT difference does it make"

well she works for a Top Secret Japanese Government agency,  Walking around looking like a Caucasian american women isn't the best disguise.   

"But Japan makes our movies with ALL JAPANESE CAST, Are they racist!"

Well I can't speak for japan, but in here in the U.S. we are a melting pot. We have the most diverse country on earth and movies sometimes and SHOULD show that.

EDIT: IF you want to know why anime looks white, read this. 
https://thesocietypages.org/socimages/2010/08/30/guest-post-why-do-the-japanese-draw-themselves-as-white/

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
This is weirdly self-conflicting. There's a lot of scenes there that pull directly from the '95 movie, but also from the TV show, SAC, and yet more that are totally unrelated to anything presented in the franchise thus far. Also, the story premise they're presenting here is wildly different than that original movie or the TV shows. Although Kusanagi was always aware of her lack of a past, that was never a focus for her character or the story. Her past is only explicitly discussed in one episode of of SAC: 2nd Gig and only hinted at occasionally outside of that, but only as a way of commenting on certain events.

But all that said, Oshii seems to like it, so maybe there's enough here to make it work.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Um... where is Section 9?  I did not see Togusa, Ishikawa, Saito, Paz, Borma, Azuma, Yano or Proto....And another thing, this origin story they are alluding to is way off canon. She was not maimed or mutilated and rebuilt by corporate assholes trying to turn her into a super weapon. (Way over used in movies already btw). Her plight is in finding her identity but because she never had a body to begin with, she has always been a consciousness inside of a machine. That is where the name "Ghost In The Shell" comes from. I will still see it and probably love it, but I think they could have stayed truer to the origin in the movies.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
To all who are concerned about here ethnicity.

The thing is, 99 percent of major's body is prosthetic. Only parts of her brain is biological. Her body or "shell" is made by Megatech Corporation which if I remember correctly is an international robotics and cybernetics manufacturer. Section 9 gets all of its parts from this corporation. Yes, her nationality and soul or "ghost" is Japanese but the parts of her body including the face could very well be for example american or other wise western. I hope that can ease the pain at least a little bit.

This trailer makes me a little more hopeful for the movie, but still seems like it will focus a lot more on the action aspect rather than the philosophical aspect.  The best case scenario is that this ends up like the Watchmen movie; not horrendous but missing some of the substance of the source material. The CGI though not only looks A LOT more finished than in the teaser clips but also looks the part (in visual style) so I will give it that.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I’m a huge anime fan, and I absolutely love seeing big budget adaptations of my favorite anime. Listen, I acknowledge that there’s a huge lack of Asian representation in Hollywood but this isn’t the movie to scream “whitewashing” about. Hollywood is a business, and they need to make a profit. Ghost In the Shell is a FRINGE anime whose core fanbase is not big enough to justify the multi-million dollar budget this film has. The studio had to hire an A-List star to draw in the general public, people who never heard of anime in their entire life. 

We can’t have it both ways. Either they cast an unknown Asian actor and create a low budget indie movie (which would be horrible for this particular franchise) or cast a movie star and give this adaptation the budget it deserves. The latter option is a win/win for fans and the movie studio, who need a return on their investment. 

We need to hold Hollywood accountable for not casting Asian actors in everyday tv shows and movies. Raise your voice and speak up for Asians not being in sitcoms and primetime dramas or movies without anything to do with sci-fi or fantasy. That’s when true change will happen.

Why is it that every time White American actors and actresses have to fill in for the Asian roles in movies? I mean I have nothing against Scarlett Johansson she is a great actress but having white American actors and actresses fill in for Asian roles is unacceptable. Hollywood should have Asians actors and actresses do their part in these types of movies. Ghost in the Shell started in Japan, I've been a fan of the show for a long time and at least have a Japanese actress do the role like Rinko Kikuchi, Karen Fukuhara, or any other Asian actresses who would be interested to take the role.

I am just expressing my opinion on the subject.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
whoa, alright. I can tell you that this movie, if the trailers show where the movie's direction is going, it completely wrong. They are emphasizing the android bodies, which is in original film is not even an important part of the film. body enhancements are the normal. In fact, Togusa only has a memory upgrade and the rest of him is mostly human which leaves the rest of the team impressed and slightly bitter that he is able to keep up with the team without enhancements.

The main focus of the movie is when the a human not longer a human but something else. that is the real heart of the original film. in addition, it looks like this film is combining both Ghost in the Shell and Innocence and both of those movies have different topics. 

my advice to anyone interested in this film, go watch the original animated films ghost in the shell and Innocence and just skip this.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
It's almost as if people complaining about the Major being white haven't even seen a single iteration of the GitS franchise, but saw the name "Mokoto Kusanagi" assigned to a white woman and went full autism.

The Major is completely cybernetic, meaning that she could have any race and any appearance that the writer chose. 

Additionally, her appearance has basically been completely ethnically ambiguous/neutral throughout the franchise and each iteration. The writer could have omitted the name "Mokoto" and simply call her "the Major" as most people in the series already do.

And there is nothing inherently Japanese about the themes and the story except that it takes place in Japan, and that it has Japanese people. But the story could take place literally anywhere with a city setting and the story would remain practically the same.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
scarlett johansson looks good for the role but I dont think the atmosphere really captures the original too well. It does not seem CYBERPUNK as much.. just kinda looks like a modern city with unnecessarily large holograms  with couple random avant garde fashion people in the streets or something. Seriously they just took a video of today's everyday streets and just threw in some floating koi fish and thats it. I expected more dystopian cyberpunk city in a night setting and more mechs with hundreds of different immaculately moving parts. And more WIRES, TONS and TONS of looping and spiraling wires connected to body parts which pretty much defines the gritty look of ghost in the shell. They did have little bit of that with the monks at the end but WTF? Just ONE wire for each person? There should be at least 10 wires or something. Man, that just looks shallow. It doesnt even have a spider tank probably because CG team could not dare to manage it. They really did not make this look good even with the original that had amazing visuals to use as reference. 
I said scarlet johansson looked good for the Kusanagi role but when she said "maybe next time you can design me better", her delivery was very weak. Kusanagi Motoko is very strong character and stern soldier. I can think of several better way of her saying something like that. She is also capable of extremely sophisticated acrobatic moves(cyborg and all) but all you really get in this video is typical asf slow motion wall running.. She also looks like shes just wearing a nylon tights btw.
Why remake a 3D movie out of it if 2D original looks so much better? All their selling point in this video is pretty much straight from the original anyway(geisha robots, building dive, invisible fist fight on a water)
No I havent seen the movie yet but I dont think it will be good.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I watch this with a mixture of excitement and disgust. 

Excitement because a few things here really look promising. But a lot of it may be just the GITS fanboy inside of me. And the producers should be very aware of the fact that, using so much original material (scenery/story) will inevitably make people compare. And if your movie looks worse than what was produced 1995, you know you're not doing it right, right?
So I feel disgust because they handled a lot of the sourcematerial worse than the anime movies/series. And with the animes handrendering technics, especially of the first movie, they had it a lot harder to control the visuals then the CGI nowadays. Yet composition and detail looks partially worse than in 1995.
And I am also worried. They seem to try to cramp far too much material into one story, which was used for many different storylines over years, instead of focusing more of their energy into less, to creat truly perfect scenery and story. I'd rather watch a shorter good movie than a longer worse one. Lets see how this all turns out. But I would keep my hopes low, to not suffer even more dissapointment.

Some feelings I felt while watching:
1. Major leaps from the tower (yes yes yes!!), breaks the window and jumps into the room (wait what?!). Really really hope these where footage from 2 different scenes. 
2. CGI and movement of the major are lacking the grace, beauty and fluidity. This is an action SciFi, please use budget where it matters.
3. From a realistic perspective, Robo-Geishas should be stunningly beautiful, but they made them just look like cool robots, defeating the purpose of them being Gaishas in the first place. From an artistic standpoint, the contrast between the beauty of traditional Geishas and the technical, cold complexity of advanced machinery is what makes Robo-Geishas so great in my eyes.
4. The scenery of the normal streets lack the overcrowded details of the original, makes the scenery feel somewhat empty for me.
5. They tryed to use the color scemes in the originals as guides, but in the scenes they fail to replicate it, it really stands out.
