Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: As a Ghost in the Shell FANATIC I still don't know what to make of this. I liked the original Manga, Ghost in the Shell and Ghost in the Shell 2: Innocents are among my favorite films of all time and Stand Alone Complex (both seasons) is my favorite anime/show of all time. So, I WILL be seeing this at day one and I am very optimistic...but, I am also very nervous. This trailer looks a little too much like a fan made trailer [albeit an incredible one] and it looks like it's trying WAY to hard to recreate the magic of the original 1995 film. Although I will say this; I'm not mad about Scarlett Johansson as Kusanagi, I think she's a cool choice

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Lots of people complain about Scarjo being a bad choice for Motoko, but rarely mention the other characters.WHO THOUGHT IT WAS A GOOD IDEA TO HAVE THAT GUY PLAY BATOU? HE LOOKS LIKE A BAD COSPLAY!But, yeah, Scarlet is a terrible choice for the character, for a variety of reasons besides just not being Asian.Her and the director of the film don't really seem to get the character, one of the other teasers showed her shaking in fear quite noticeably while aiming a pistol, which doesn't really fit the character's rather stoic reactions to dangerous situations, nor does she have the significant uncanny valley effect present in the oshii film this adaption seems to be mostly basing itself on, trading creepy, doll like eyes with a permanant thousand yard stare for that thing Scarlet frequently does where her eyes are looking slightly away from each other.She also has a completely different look from the character, major in the mango and anime had more of an 80's female bodybuilder physique, with the excessive tan being absent in the anime, Scarlet on the other hand is just built like a fairly average woman, which along with losing floofy hair for what looks like a bad wig cut up by a five year old, and the camo suit having a completely generic design which loses the skin tight, vacuum fitted latex look of the original to cater to the average American's irrational fear of nipples, makes the character design look far, far worse, it loses everything that made the original unique and memorable....and she's not Asian. Anyone who thinks Scarlet was a good choice for this role is absolutely delusional, having a bad imitation of a character's hairstyle =/= portraying them faithfully.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I understand why many Americans (yes, Americans, not Japanese, not Europeans, not Koreans or anyone else, just Americans) still hate the idea of Scarlett playing a character previously portrayed as Asian. If this was instead a biography film starring real-life people and the main character was black but instead he was played by a white dude, you would be angry at Hollywood for whitewashing history. HOWEVER this is not a biography film, this is a fictional film and you people are angry not because of whitewashing but because Hollywood had the chance to create new fame and fortune for the latest Asian American movie star of what many of you feel is a highly underrepresented group in America but instead Hollywood played it too safe and wanted Scarlet, not because she was white but because she was famous and would guarantee the movie a lot of money. Many of you fellow Americans are not angry because of whitewashing, you guys are angry because you feel Asian Americans have been underrepresented more than any other "race" or group in American entertainment, specifically blockbuster movies.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Aesthetically this movie looks fantastic but it's a crying shame they didn't cast an Asian actress in the lead role. Scarlett Johansson isn't a talented actress. She plays the same character in all her action movies without even a slight nuance. So if anyone wants me to believe the producers were just prioritizing talent over race, all I can do is laugh. There are 7 billion people on this planet. It is a racist suggestion that there aren't incredibly talented actors and actresses of every race and it's insulting to my intelligence if you expect me to believe the only motivation here isn't money. They just want to trade in on Johansson's fame, despite the fact that numerous actors of color have demonstrated that they can play leads in films that go on to be wildly profitable.

And it just adds insult to injury that she's not even a good actress. Is there a single credible reason why someone like Rinko Kikuchi couldn't play Kusanagi?

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Ok, once again this makes me a little more confident in this movie: they capture the aesthetic of both the movies and the series well with some interesting additions as well as the use of practical effects. However I still get this weird vibe from Scarlett's acting. Not in a "OMG they should've cast an asian actor OMG" rage fit, I'm trying to move away from that so I can more fairly judge this movie. It feels a little awkward, like they could've placed slightly more humanity behind her words. I get it, she's a robot, but even in the manga and anime the Major had at least a little sense of humor despite the fact she never even blinked. However if they can pull of the "emotionless girl" trope with Scarlett like they've done in the past then all the more power to them.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I think Scarlett Johansson is a good choice for being cast as the Major, and judging from the trailer I can't imagine who would do a better job or play the role better than her, and yes I have seen the Japanese animated film Ghost in the Shell, as well as the series Stand Alone Complex. Most of the main characters don't look Asian, mind you there are some that do in the original animated film but the Major and Bato are not them, the look very Caucasian. I really don't understand why people are accusing this film of "white washing" when it's not there. I really hope that this film is a success and that it introduces more people to the awesome and cool story that is "Ghost in the Shell".

I know fans such as myself want this film adaptation of Ghost in the Shell to have the same look and feel of the original animated film, judging from the trailer it does a very good job. I really don't want this movie to end up like Dragonball: Evolution, that movie was just a mess and was not a good experience, and I don't think this film will end up in such an abysmal failure like that movie did.

She was never "the first of her kind", cyborgs be everywhere in that fiction, I mean sure she may be one of the first humans to have a full body prosthesis but kusinagi's position as basically a government super agent was elective, and she certainly wasnt the first military grade cyborg, also she was the "major" before section 6 because she was an actual goddamn MAJOR, like in the goddamn army, its not just a nickname. Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Okay so, already you can tell that the writers did not understand the source material.  The major's backstory is not a Robocop style: "you were dying so we saved you by making you a robot."  This story takes place in a time where people are VOLUNTARILY cyberizing themselves.  Instead of dealing with the deep cultural and moral themes from GITS, they turned it into another "help they made me a robot" story.  No thanks.

Not surprising though.  Hollywood forgot how to make intelligent sci-fi a long time ago.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I only saw the Stand Alone Complex season and loved that, but overall I am not going to watch this movie. I do not care about the whitewashing or whatever that is called, but about the fact that this will be just like other overbudgeted films that aim for nothing but impress all CGI fanclubs. This trailer revealed much of the plot which I have no idea whether has been in the original anime series, but we can also see how it is done - in such a fake way...

I am not a hater, I just don't want to be disappointed. It's been a long time since random action movies with concepts taken from somewhere and poor production despite a good budget, action movies whose only talent is the CGI guys' talents, have been able to impress me.

Comment: Honestly, I think this looks okay. I think there will always be tag along stigma to American adaptations of content from other countries, which is fair in some respects, but if you're basing your opinion of a movie on a trailer alone, it just shows you were unwilling to like it even before you watched the trailer. Some people think they are 'betraying' the source material to like something like this, but I don't see how anyone can ignore the fact that this looks visually stunning, and from what little we've seen of the characters so far I can't really make a good or bad judgement. Effectively, by white washing roles now then can help generate more actors from foreign backgrounds in the future!

Ummm... never mind. I think this RE-MOVIE will trip on it's own HYPE and here's why, the OG-MOVIE of this RE-MOVIE was really really really really GOOD THE END. But no seriously they might mess this RE-MOVIE up by making it a """soapy""" """oranges story""",  boring """CSI mystery story""" and have CG special effects that have no impact or emotion at all. So what i'm saying is this RE-MOVIE could be tone death and suck? ya really suck. The OG-MOVIE was not an oranges story, it was a window to the way the world was, it was not soapy it was raw and lived in, it did have a little boring side but it's OK for exposition to be a little boring, and the CG/cell animation was good because all of it was done by professionals that where directed and or by guy's that made this stuff all by hand back in the day. I hope i'm wrong in any case and this RE-MOVIE gives my goosebumps and inspires me in some way.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: The original anime was all about the nature of existentialism, consciousness, and the id with extreme focus on setting and mood.  There are entire scenes which contain only soundtrack music and technopunk backdrops.  Think "Blade Runner" on sake bombers and absinthe. If the director is good (and he is), he'll attempt to match the draw with a formulaic storyline which doesn't attempt to appear too high-brow for the average viewer but also doesn't resort to juvenile action sequences which Michael Bay is so fond of.  It's about time we had a more intelligent sci fi movie that DOESN'T pander to toyish Hollywood fare.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
All the visuals are there, I can not complain about that, it is as similar to the anime as it can be for a live action movie. But story wise, it has been dumbed down for a Hollywood audience with an IQ below 50. This has nothing to do with the complex philosophical themes the anime explored. This sounds more like a Robocop type of story with a mediocre twist at the end. "You were dying, we saved you". No, in the anime, she wasn't saved, she was just a cyborg with an existential crisis.
Insert the "Everything-they-told-you-was-a-lie" cliché here. And the "They-did-not-save-your-life,-they-stole-it" cliché there...

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I hold back from getting excited - I'm still scared from Dragon Ball Evolution. How ever I am open to a re-imagining of the classic hit, I'm also very happy with Scarlett playing the role of Motoko. So even at it's worst it'll give the chance for me to see a live action adaption of the ghost in the shell world, and that alone is worth the price of a ticket.

Oh how I would love to see a live-action film of "the laughing man" - done well, ofcause.

Comment:
Похоже Скарлет не поняла свою героиню. Она играет так, как будто это просто фентези-боевик. 
Дубль на подоконнике, посмотрите, она там позирует как на фотосессии.  А это жилая комната, героиня там думала в одиночестве. А не принимала позы концентрируясь на себе. Героиня не фотомодель, она офицер, спецназ полиции, и часто думает о жизни и смерти, она слышит голоса . Кто она, машина или человек? Она киборг, или она живое существо? Когда героиня майор Кусанаги борется один на один с роботом-танком на фоне дерева эволюции, мы на самом деле наблюдаем как борятся две ветки эволюции машин. И мы приходим к вопросу: "Что такое жизнь?". Это философия, а не тупой боевик с фотомоделью.
Хотя чего ждать от американцев? :)

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I'm not going to complain about the race of the actors, because I think the best actor for the role or job should get it regardless of race and as long as the story doesn't rely on racial perspectives, but I can't see myself believing that Scarlett Johansson is the Major... Imo, Sigourney Weaver back in the day or Gwendoline Christie (Brienne of Tarth from Game of Thrones) seem like they would both be better for Major than Scarlett. Also, while I don't know how this is going to turn out, I really wish Hollywood would at least try to keep the theme of the source material, even if they need to change some parts for multiple audiences. This seems a lot like Bourne Identity rather than what the original Ghost in the Shell was.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Regarding the whitewashing issue, I'd like to offer a different view. I think the choice of lead actress is not (just) a case of Hollywood whitewashing.  

I think the issues present in the GitS franchise are becoming more and more relevant to the collective thought and conversation, now that technologies that were until now seen as "future technology", such as robotic limbs and more complex AI are being developed. I think that the choice of lead actress is just better fit for this purpose of injecting these ideas for rumination and conversation in the western world. 

Still, I think it's a shame that this movie was not made with an Asian lead actress, keeping to the original story and setting. However, I think the creator of GitS was aware of this live action movie's purpose of injecting these ideas into the mainstream when he said that he does not care about the choice of Caucasian lead actress.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: (1) White Girl (2) English Language (3) A grotesque Hollywood iteration of a fantastic Japanese anime.  I really wanted to see the Japanese woman from Pacific Rim play the lead role here.  Should have been all Japanese cast with Japanese language like the anime. I love watching anime with English subtitles it's how it is meant to be watched god damn it.  This is soooooooooooooo disappointing no matter how visually beautiful the movie is.  This movie would have been received 10x better if they used a Japanese cast.  I would have gone to see this in the movie theater especially if it was Japanese language with English subtitles (a true foreign film).  Instead I'll wait until it's available from Redbox or Netflix. Nothing against Scarlett Johanson she is a good actress but she's not Japanese.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I think that the trailer looks awesome and as a massive fan of the original I'm willing to give this a chance. I'll give it one chance.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Well to put my reaction to the comments all it was just: "WoW......."
Seriously I expected a worse type of thing but WOW THIS LOOKS GOOD! Now obviously this is just a trailer therefore all the people who liked the trailer and is ready to pre-order the tickets for the movie I say we all have to calm down and get ready for whatever that could be wrong.....

Though the last movie that I awaited this much which was Warcraft was AMAZING (but its Blizzard we talking about so we cant expect anything less) there were movies which may have been declared to be bad already (the Dawn of Justice and the new Ghostbusters for example) and there were movies which were anticipated but many got out of the cinemas with bad experience (many for example didn't liked the new X-Men movie and the Suicide Squad) BUT! as I said we got tons and TONS of good movies as well which were anticipated and basically kicked the expectations to higher and then they delievered it (like Star Wars, Deadpool, Captain Murica 2, Warcraft,)

So I say for the fact that the sea of the movies has been really dangerous at these times (for we don't know and we can't just decide things from trailers that the movie will be good or not because it can suprise us both in the good and the bad way) Therefore I say that okay the trailer looks amazing and I guess I'm gonna rewatch it a couple of time because I AWAIT THIS MOVIE! and I really really REALLY! hope that the movie will be as awesome as probably many of us expect it to be

Peace out! :]

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: People are going to hate it regardless of what it's quality is. There are people who despise the Lord of the Rings trilogy which are arguably the best book-to-film adaptations ever.Talking about the race issue is truly useful and necessary especially in a situation such as this, but seeming the film as "trash" just due to Hollywood whitewashing is ignoring the work put into the visuals, cinematography, direction, plot etc. Don't judge a whole film on the changing of a character(s), judge it on what actually affects it as a film.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: I feel like I shouldn't like this, because "Hollywood only cares about the masses, they don't respect source material, etc." But, as a fan of the GiTS franchise, I'm liking this so far. The issue with live-action movies based on anime is that usually the japanese studios don't have a big budget, so the CGI ends up sloppy-looking, and not enough money and time goes into casting and writing as it should. So Hollywood, with a much bigger budget, can improve on some of these issues. For example, the CGI looks beautiful in this trailer, (which is important in a cyber-punk world like GiTS's) and I, personally, like Scarlett's performance until now (as a side note, it can't be considered white-washing if the character isn't even Japanese in the first place). Don't get me wrong though. These are all PERSONAL OPINIONS based on solely THE TRAILER. So, the movie can still be crap. But I won't call it shit just now. I'll wait and see. I'll actually watch the movie before judging it. (excuse my english, it's not my native language)

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I'm disappointed, I thought they would make a live action version of the animated movie Ghost in the shell. While some scenes are taken from the animation such as the water scene it seems that they made up own stuff a bit too much. (be advised I have not yet seen the complete series) As I recall Major was nothing fancy as 'The first' that would indicate she is the chosen one but she was simply one of many who developed to become more of a philosopher. 

The invisibility was nothing built in to her body which seems to be the case in this trailer but rather a technology using a specific type of cloth. The Major and Batou had a long relationship even at the start of the animation and that is why they has such trust in each other in the trailer it is indicated that Batou is newly created. 

This movie would do good to copy as much as possible from the animation not go their own way with things. Well I do hope it will be good anyway but probably not as I had hoped.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
I am a huge Ghost in the Shell fan. I have read the manga, watched the films, watched Stand Alone Complex, watched ARISE, etc. I have seen and read pretty much every major media around the Ghost in the Shell franchise. 

This movie, to me, looks fantastic. Not only is the tone down very well, but the main part of the GitS Franchise is the philosophies and themes of "Identity". Even if you don't notices it right away, every character, plotline, and story involved with the series is connected to Identity. Not just of the Major herself, but also of the people she comes across and knows. This movie looks to be following those themes very well, and I can't wait to see what's in store.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: Still not sure what to think of this. Parts of it looks like an amazing shot for shot live-action remake of the original anime, but other parts look like they didn't really use the original story about the puppet master. And in my experience, when film-makers try to adapt a popular franchise but then don't use the original story because they are desperate to make it "their own", that backfires in 10 out of 10 cases. That's why most movies based on video games fail: they don't use the original story from the games and instead write a shitty new story, not realising that most of the fanbase of the source material are fans BECAUSE of the original story.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
You guys are gonna have to accept one thing.
Adaptions are never going to be spot on, Hollywood will never adapt anything right. Whether it's a book, anime or comic.
They will never give a shit about the lore, they will never give a shit about the fans.
What they want, is the masses. The standard consumer.
I already knew the day they announced they were gonna make a GiTS adaption, that it'd be shite.
BUT
I'm gonna watch it, I'm not gonna watch it as a GiTS movie. I'm gonna watch it as a cyberpunk movie that lends from the GiTS universe. If you want to enjoy this movie or any adaption that comes out of Hollywood, I'd suggest you'd do the same. Otherwise you're just setting yourself up for disappointment, because lets be real here, you shouldn't expect anything nowadays.
Never forget though, we still have the real GiTS and it will never leave.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
The trailer ticks a lot of the right boxes:
- Cyberpunk aesthetic.
- The Major isn't wearing anything as she fights and uses camo.
- Traditional 'making of a cyborg' sequence.
- Batou's robot eyes.
- Togusa's six-shooter.
- The diving scene from the first film.
- The Arise costume.
- Possibly the Tachikoma(?) fight from the first film.

Not getting my hopes up but ill be happy if its decent.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: To anyone& everyone complaining about whitewashing over ScarJo's casting as The Major. In the original manga upon which the movie and all other subsequent versions are based, Motoko/The Major is stated as preferring European (i.e. Caucasian) bodies. This is a fact backed up by Shirow Masamune, The Series Creator, in the appendices of said manga and multiple interviews. So this isn't just a case of her being drawn to look European due to some artistic stylization and giving her a mukokuseki (stateless) appearance that is popular in manga and anime. It's due to The Major herself being mukokuseki/stateless. This is coming from someone who has had Ming Na Wen cast as The Major since 1997 or 98. Scarlet isn't my first choice, but I think she's a good choice and will play her well.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
Wow, that looks terrible.  I'm honestly not sure they could have made that movie even further from the actual plot of the original comics, movies, and tv series'.  Kusanagi has always known her past.  Yes, she doubted it a little once, in one scene, in the first movie, but she still knew who she was, past or no past.  And her being the first?  That takes away from the entire plot point of her being generic and using a common body for her own.  It's her doubting her identity because so many others have the same external shells.  In the series this was updated to her having a specifically important watch because it was an external memory device; something she comments that many cyborgs rely on.

And the soundtrack is miserable.  Couldn't they get Kenji Kawai to work on it to make it as amazing as the original?  Talk about trying to make a pale image through a cloudy mirror and selling it to the blind.

Comment:
I tried to approach this with an open mind. But it's not looking good. It's too loud, too bright and too on the nose. The original had an under stated charm. Motoko isn't a super-human naked kung fu master. And the villain of the movie isn't supposed to be some ball-out crazy dude. It's capitalism and bureaucratic greed.

Also, wtf Bateau looks like shit!

PS. Being from Hong Kong that cemetery scene and the caged houses do bring some nostalgia tho.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment: This dialogue is so on the nose. I remember watching the original 5 times before I felt like I really knew what was going on, and the creators of this remake seem determined to get that number down to the first 30 minutes of the first viewing. Not knowing what was going on at first, or even at third viewing, didn't make me enjoy it less; on the contrary I loved being challenged. This remake doesn't seem challenging at all, unless they are leaving some major stuff out.

Title: Ghost in the Shell Official Trailer 1 (2017) - Scarlett Johansson Movie
Comment:
From the looks of it the action looks good and if anything it will be entertaining. Will it be better that the original 95 movie probably not. It looks very inconsistent with the source material (and I have no idea why since it was already a master piece) and that will most likely prove its dislike among original fans such as myself and even other anime lovers but like I said if anything it should at least be entertaining. 

Its funny I had an argument with someone a while back when the first really short trailer came out and he argued that it was based off of stand alone complex but its clearly more structured around the 95 movie. I highly recommend watching the original as I think it will prove much more than this but meh do what you please.
